column1: 1989 in Berlin: Scenes of the Peaceful Revolution ¤ As the capital of the GDR, East Berlin was an important center of the Peaceful Revolution of 1989. Ingo Juchler takes the readers to the central scenes of the events, spanning from June 17, 1953, through the protest movement of the 1970s to the demonstrations in the fall of 1989 and the events surrounding the fall of the wall. Informative texts on the background, numerous illustrations, and a map make the book a vivid time-travel guide to recent German history

Linear Algebra and Analytic Geometry: A Textbook for Physicists and Mathematicians ¤ The first five chapters of this new textbook correspond in content and method to the standard of a modern lecture on Linear Algebra. The representation is visually and geometrically from the beginning. One arrives at conic sections, projective geometry, the main axis transformation, tensors, Lie algebras, and symplectic groups to the fundamental statements of Linear Algebra over rings. Physicists will find a discussion of quaternions, Pauli matrices, orthogonal and unitary groups, and the Lorentz group. TOC:Common knowledge.- I. Vector spaces.- II. Matrix calculations.- III. The determinant.- IV. Bilinear forms.- V. The Jordan normal form.- VI. Geometry.- VII.Tensor calculations.- VIII. Linear groups and Lie algebras.- IX. Quaternions and orthogonal groups.- X. Rings and modules

Lebendiges vom Tod : Reflections on Life and Death ; 7./8. Grade ¤ The students think about their own mortality and the afterlife conceptions of different religions. Inspired by stories, images, and their own creative shaping, they experience over the course of 10 learning stations that death is indeed part of life - and beyond that points out.

Bioinformatics : an introductory textbook ¤ Genetics and systems biology develop in a dialogue between laboratory and computer. The introduction to bioinformatics presents the most important tools together with the basic knowledge of the subject. At the center is the automated analysis of the genome using databases and evaluation software. A great enrichment are the historical and interdisciplinary excursions as well as the linking of biochemical and information-scientific connections up to artificial intelligence. A glossary and tutorial on the most important instruments allow students from life and information sciences to work independently on the material. This provides a true alternative to established textbooks (e.g. M.-T. Hütt: ID-G 11/16). Many suggestions are also offered to the interested layperson. A little more care in the annotations could have made the illustrations even more understandable. A occasionally noticeable influence of English specialist language on the German text is noticeable in word choice and formulations. (2-3)

Biochemistry : an Introduction with 40 Learning Units ¤ Biochemistry: Learning Made Easy The Content:-The Molecules of Life -Molecular Genetics-Metabolism-Cells and Their Environment-Molecular Physiology-Biochemical Methods The Concept: -40in self-contained learning units of 10-15 pages-Comprehensive, concise, and didactically refined Biochemistry: Learning Makes Fun

Devilishly Good Web Design : How to Lure Your Customers ¤ Your customers should love your website? Feel right at home there - and do what you want? In a furious mix of psychology, marketing, and design, Chris Nodder shows you how it's done. He speaks out what we all know: We have small weaknesses. We want to belong, get things for free, not have to exert ourselves too much, not have to say no, and many other things. Based on these small weaknesses, he gives you simple, implementable design patterns that you can use to make the use of your website particularly pleasant for your customers - or at least the activities you want your customers to do. The countless examples from all corners of the internet make the explanations even more tangible. It's up to you: Let yourself be tempted and switch to the dark side of power with your new knowledge, or use it for the benefit of humanity? (Publisher's text)

Speed of migrating bedforms on the sea floor : a review ¤ This report summarizes the results of a literature study on the migration rate of dunes on the sea floor. It shows that especially older studies without fixed markers on the sea floor suffer from positional inaccuracies and are of no significance for further theoretical calculations. In general, the migration speed decreases significantly with height. Sand dunes with more than 1 m height are largely fixed in place and migrate very slowly (less than 10 cm/day) for questions of sedimentation of small objects. For megaripples up to about 50 cm height, the assessment can be made that they normally migrate at a rate of up to 50 cm/day, but under certain circumstances they can also migrate much faster. Notably, there is a clear temporal and spatial variability in the speed of individual megaripples. This question is to be further investigated for models. (AUT)

Luxus der Leere : From the Difficult Withdrawal from the Growth World : [A Polemical Essay] ¤ Shrinking cities, desolate landscapes: The current urban debates are dominated by anxious tones. More than a million apartments are currently vacant in Eastern Germany and are to be largely demolished. The West is also feeling the effects of the transformation processes: Where traditional production sites are abandoned, more and more balancing and regulatory mechanisms are faltering. The housing crisis in the new federal states is only an indicator of a far-reaching change in our familiar social and regional structures as a whole.

Handbook of plastic optics ¤ Optical and optomechanical components made of plastic are at the center of this volume. All stages of the production process from design to materials, equipment, and technologies to quality control are treated. A indispensable work for all experts in optical components in research and development

Computerlexikon für Dummies : [get smart about EDV ; at a glance: all the important stuff around the PC ; over 2000 terms explained in a way that's easy to understand ; Windows 7 and the latest technologies ; for quick reference from A to Z] ¤ Review: The Computer Lexicon appears in the fifth edition in the popular

The World Line : Albert Einstein and Modern Physics ¤ The book is a loosely written and almost formula-free representation of 20th-century physics, with special consideration of Albert Einstein's achievements (1879-1955), where the findings of Einstein's predecessors are also taken into account in this 3rd novel (lastly: "Dragon's Gate", BA 6/07) from the "Dragon and Elf Dust" and finds to an astonishing degree of refreshing and meaningful complexity. The novel ranges between fantasy and a thriller with Victorian charm. Even thanks to the attractive cover, the numerous fans of the author should be easily reached.

Ingenieurmathematics compact - Problem solutions with MATLAB: Introduction and reference work for engineers and natural scientists ¤ In this book, the MATLAB mathematics system is consistently used to solve mathematical problems using computers

Tutorial Analysis 1 and Linear Algebra 1: Mathematics explained and commented by students for students ¤ Each section begins with the definitions of the most important terms, followed by a collection of relevant theorems with proofs. Subsequent explanations with occasional original examples clarify and illuminate the whole. In this way, the text guides the reader through the usual material of a 1st semester in the field of mathematics. After introducing general foundations, proof techniques, and structures, a presentation of analysis follows up to the core statements of differential and integral calculus. The last part on linear algebra begins with the concrete problem of equation systems and leads over the theory of vector spaces to matrices, determinants, and eigenvalues. The authors, familiar with the difficulties of first-semester students in this field, successfully strive for clarity. Occasional somewhat vague formulations, such as the introduction of the indefinite integral as a function, are pardonable. The very helpful book for beginners is largely also suitable for students in a SII performance course. (3 S)

Damage in Dry Construction: Recognition and Avoidance ¤ *Further information Author: The Institute for Building Research e. V. (IFB) in Hanover informs those involved in construction about science, education, practice, and research. It has been creating foundations for expert opinions, further investigations, developments, and inventions since 1946. Members of the IFB are the federal and several state ministries responsible for the building industry and housing, peak associations of the building industry, housing industry, and energy industry, universities, cities, housing companies, and companies of the economy

Mathematics for Natural Scientists: Methods, Applications, Program Codes ¤ Compact mathematics book for students of natural sciences, except physics, which requires a more demanding mathematical instrumentarium. Examples of scientific applications ensure a link to practice. The exercise tasks are also partially oriented towards the application-oriented testing of the learned - occasionally with a pinch of entertainment mathematics, for example, when the shooting chance of a midfielder is to be calculated (solutions are available on a university website of the University of Munich). Numerous calculation examples are accompanied by program codes for the computer algebra system Maple or the free statistics program R (cf. A. Behr: "Introduction to Statistics with R", ID 31/05). The book with the same title by W. Pavel (BA 9/07) deals with analysis and linear algebra in more detail, omits probability calculation and statistics, which are each given a chapter in the present title. Overall, a recommendable, stimulating textbook for active acquisition of the material. (2)

The unofficial Windows 7 Handbook : [Extend functions: registry tweaks for Explorer and taskbar ; solve performance brakes: secret Microsoft tools and PowerToys ; Always on: connect Windows 7 and really go online everywhere] ¤ With the "Franzis Handbook for Windows 7" (BA 1/10) and "Windows 7 - The Workshop Book" (BA 7/10), the experienced author has already extensively dealt with the latest Microsoft operating system version. Now he presents, in the old style suggesting unauthorized or semi-legal, a comprehensive guide for those users who want to make Win7 faster, better, more individual or more efficient and can. Explorer and taskbar, user interface, Microsoft tools and PowerToys, multimedia options, internet, installation, network and data security, as well as briefly notebook and data synchronization with the iPhone - Immler has collected numerous undocumented tips and tricks and presented them in a clear and understandable way (enriched with step-by-step instructions, tables and online addresses) and many informative screenshots. Even if a command line or a short listing appears occasionally, this is a book with practical instructions, usable for everyone and in the place where further offers are to be made. (2)

Grundwissen Beneficial Organisms : Helpers in Modern Plant Protection ¤ In plant protection literature, pests and damage patterns are usually shown. Beneficial organisms are often not recognized as such. In this book, the most important beneficial organisms in the garden are depicted in color illustrations and drawings, their effect on pests and their application possibilities in the framework of biological and integrated plant protection measures are described. The range of illustrations extends from spiders and insects to amphibians, reptiles, birds, and insectivorous mammals. The slim volume is rather unobtrusive in its external appearance. In addition to and after the more attractive and significantly more comprehensive handbook "The Great Kosmos Book of Beneficial Organisms" (s. M. Fortmann, BA 8/00), it can still be recommended for libraries with corresponding demand. (2)

Computational Assessment of the Effects of Hydrodynamic Impact Processes : Part B7 of the Collaborative Project Life-Cycle Design ; Final Report ¤ Ship hydrodynamics, Slamming, Sloshing, Finite-Volume Method, free surface, Container ships, Tankers, Catamarans

Research-intensive Industries and Knowledge-intensive Services in International Comparison ¤ The present study examines the technological performance of Germany in international comparison. It shows that the German economy as a whole has a relatively strong specialization in research-intensive industries and knowledge-intensive services. However, Germany has some weaknesses in knowledge-intensive services, which are a key driver of value creation and employment growth in all countries. This is particularly true for labor productivity, which has declined between 1995 and 2015 and is significantly below the productivity of knowledge-intensive services in other countries. German foreign trade in research-intensive goods has significantly declined in the wake of the Corona pandemic. The decline in foreign trade is particularly due to trade in motor vehicles and accessories in high-tech, which was strongly affected by supply chain problems. The examination of foreign trade specialization in research-intensive goods shows a declining trend in the medium term, but the comparative advantages were still maintained almost stable during the Corona pandemic.

Socialnomics : how Social Media change Business and Society ¤ Verl.Beschr.: Social Media like Facebook, YouTube and Twitter are the media of the future. Erik Qualman shows in this book in detail, how the daily behavior of people is fundamentally changed by Social Media and how companies can use this for their marketing strategies.

Foundations and Construction of a Passive House ¤ Informative title for builders and planners who are interested in energy-saving building concepts. With rising energy prices and falling production prices for improved technical components and building parts, the construction of a passive house becomes increasingly economical. Compared to the 1st edition 2002 (BA 1/03 - can be consumed) updated with regard to technical and legal developments, supplemented with Internet addresses and expanded with a chapter with 4 exemplary, innovative passive house concepts. Already for smaller libraries before the significantly more expensive C. Grobe "Passive houses plan and build" (BA 4/03), before the collections of examples "New Passive Houses" (ID 6/04), "Large Passive Houses" (ID 8/06), "Energy efficiency - the best single-family houses" (BA 12/02) and after Th. Königstein: "Guide to energy-saving building" (see in this issue). (2)

A Brief History of Plastics ¤ A brief history of plastics, great for all those interested in the origin of plastics and the development of this material class to its current significance. The book offers the perfect mix of academic and informative content, making it suitable for both engineers and art students. The entire history of plastics is presented for the first time, from the historical development of this youngest material class from antiquity to the present day. After a brief introduction to the basic concepts and the origin of plastics, the epochs of plastic history from prehistory to the present day and the most important products developed during this time, which are used technically, are described, taking into account the social and technical history. A timeline with the most important dates and names in the history of plastics provides a good overview. The second edition has been consistently improved and includes some additions.

Human-Computer Interaction : Basic Knowledge for Developers and Designers ¤ The book reminds one of a computer science lecture, as exciting as one expects from such a thing: not very entertaining. The topic is very correctly represented in its entirety, including consideration of relevant DIN standards. It's about: software ergonomics, human information processing, hardware, dialogue design, human-centered system development, etc. Designers and developers get a very solid - theoretical - foundation, how a website, a program must be designed so that it does not cause irritation in communication with humans. Important topic, relevant for many, comprehensive correct representation, eye-catching appearance - but stylistically unfortunately a bit dry. (2)

Technical Freehand Drawing : Textbook and Exercise Book ¤ Practice-oriented textbook and exercise book for sketching technical task assignments for a broad circle of professionals. Well-structured, suitable for self-study course with numerous tasks (solutions in the appendix). Compared to the 5th edition 2004 (BA 3/05), it was updated in the section "Foundations of Craftsmanship", the structure and scope of the book remained roughly the same. The 5th edition can be consumed, the updated new edition should be acquired as well. (2)

Better coding ¤ The author deals with the creation of program code and gives advice in a humorous way, supported by many examples and anecdotes, on how effective and modern program code can be created. This topic is also treated by V. Vernon and U. Probst, among others, in a very objective form and for readers with significant prior knowledge. The chapter headings "Prevent the Apocalypse" or the word choice "Trash Software" already reveal the presentation style of the book. However, the book should be taken seriously. 12 chapters with code examples in Java and C also make it clear to the beginner programmer what is important for good effective program code, and that cooperation and experience exchange in the team are very important. Emphasis is placed on testing, OOP paradigms, design patterns, operational security, and the renewal of completely outdated software. Furthermore, the quiz questions in the appendix (with solutions) are also continued.

Deep Learning : the comprehensive handbook : foundations, current methods and algorithms, new research approaches ¤ Mathematical foundations for Machine and Deep Learning. Comprehensive treatment of contemporary methods: deep feedforward networks, regularization, performance optimization, as well as CNNs, recurrent and recursive neural networks. Future-oriented deep learning approaches, as well as concepts developed by Ian Goodfellow, such as Generative Adversarial Networks. Deep Learning is a subfield of Machine Learning and enables computers to learn from experience. This book comprehensively covers all aspects that play a role in the use and application of Deep Learning: In Part I, the authors explain the mathematical foundations for artificial intelligence, neural networks, machine learning, and deep learning. In Part II, current methods and algorithms used in practice are treated. In Part III, the authors provide insight into current research approaches and show new, future-oriented methods. This book is aimed at students and all those involved in research with Deep Learning, as well as software developers and computer scientists who want to use Deep Learning for their own products or platforms. Basic knowledge in mathematics, computer science, and programming is assumed.

Fassaden : Gebäudehüllen für das 21. Jahrhundert : building envelopes for the 21st century ¤ This volume brings together special solutions and ideas of facade concepts, which are outstanding in urban planning, architectural, technical, constructive and functional terms. For this purpose, 186 international architectural examples and innovative plans of renowned architects are presented, which are arranged typologically and provide a comprehensive overview of the technical possibilities of modern building envelopes - including, for example, Murphy/Jahn, Daniel Libeskind, Ingenhoven Overdiek, Gehry Partners, BRT Architects, Foster and Partners, Richard Meier & Partners, WS Atkins & Partners

Leisure-Oriented Spatial Planning in Practice : Contributions from Hesse, Rhineland-Palatinate, and Saarland ¤ Tourism and leisure represent a complex field of responsibilities, spatial delimitations, conceptual approaches, and programs in planning practice. The working group "Leisure" of the Landesarbeitsgemeinschaft Hessen / Rhineland-Palatinate / Saarland of the ARL has illuminated for the three countries as representative as possible questions and important intersections of "non-specialized planning" leisure and spatial planning. In this process, the structure of leisure planning is presented and fundamental problems and deficits in the planning coordination are addressed. Selected case examples show regional peculiarities (also from a neighboring country), which are partly detailed with empirical studies.

Corrosion-Resistant Steel in Infrastructure: Bridges from Around the World ¤ There are hundreds of thousands of bridges worldwide, with around 120,000 on German federal highways, country roads, and municipal roads – and the number is growing. Bridge structures are a crucial component of the transportation infrastructure and a basic requirement for private mobility, as well as for the smooth transportation of goods and the provision of services. ... The case studies documented in this brochure show the use of corrosion-resistant steels in bridges for road, pedestrian, rail, and bicycle traffic, as well as combined use. The locations are in hot as well as cold climatic zones, in inland areas as well as coastal regions.

Relational Database Systems : A Practical Introduction ; with numerous examples and exercise tasks ; [now based on PostgreSQL] ¤ This book is a practical introduction to the design and programming of relational database systems. It conveys detailed knowledge of the database standard language SQL as well as the theoretical foundations necessary for designing such database systems. Numerous examples and extensive exercise tasks enable the reader to design their own database applications - especially for the integration of databases in the World Wide Web - after a short time. The book is particularly suitable as accompanying reading for corresponding courses at universities and universities of applied sciences in economic science courses or in the field of computer science. Even the practitioner who needs database knowledge for application development languages as well as database administration tasks will quickly acquire the necessary basic knowledge with this book. The book's data and program listings can be retrieved via the Internet, etc.

Professionally Developing with JavaScript : Design, Patterns, Best Practices ¤ Most notable changes in this challenging JavaScript textbook compared to the 1st edition: 200 more pages, hardcover, 15 euros more expensive. Unfortunately, this stands in the way of a greater dissemination, because JavaScript belongs to the basic languages of web programming and the book offers a rich fund of practice examples with source code, which can also be downloaded from the publisher's homepage. The target group are developers of professional JavaScript applications who at least already possess knowledge in other programming languages. In addition to a general introduction, topics such as functions, object-oriented programming, ECMAScript from 2015, design and architectural patterns are treated, as well as new chapters on advanced concepts, messaging, and continuous integration. After P. Ackermann's more fundamental title "JavaScript" (2016), a new edition of which will be published soon

Informationstechnology : Hardware - Software - Networks ¤ The "Compendium of Media Design" was initially a single-volume work, from the 6th edition a four-volume work (not shown here) and is now between 2017 and 2019 divided into 26 thinner volumes as "Library of Media Design" further divided. Here, the latest volume "Webdesign" was discussed, further titles are intended for discussion. The present book "Informationstechnology" offers on about 100 pages an introduction to the areas of hardware, software and networks. It conveys basic knowledge from the fields of computers and peripheral devices. At some points, further information is also referred to other volumes of the series. In addition to the explanations, there are some colored illustrations and screenshots in the content. After each chapter, there are tasks to be filled in the book - the solutions are in the appendix. The book is suitable as a textbook and workbook for the target group of apprentices and students of media design, but offers no deeper information

Renovation with Existing Stock: Sustainable Adaptation Strategies for Buildings, Spaces, and Structures ¤ The adaptation of existing structures has gained significant importance in recent years compared to new construction and expansion of floor space. But how can the renovation of buildings and built structures, spaces and open spaces, structures and infrastructures be designed to be future-proof? - - The focus of the book is on sustainable planning and design strategies that go beyond adapting existing structures to current requirements and are able to respond flexibly to changing framework conditions, even in the future. The effects of demographic, economic, social and societal change, ecological challenges from climate protection to resource management, and finally the civic anchoring of concepts and projects are particularly significant here.

Primary School is Evolving ¤ The school reforms implemented in many federal states also affect primary schools, which are subject to two visible changes in the process. On the one hand, primary schools are becoming increasingly common as full-day schools, which is intended to reduce social disparities in the first school years. On the other hand, there is a flexibilization of the school start phase, which is intended to allow children individual learning times. However, it is not yet sufficiently known which processes are triggered within the schools by these measures and what effects result from the changes in the structures. While studies such as PISA and IGLU describe the state of the education system at a certain point in time, they are not able to describe the change processes.

Reallabor „Eckernförder Bucht 2030“ : Final Report : Project Start: 01.04.2021, Duration: 12 Months (+ 2 Months Extension) ¤ The EU Marine Strategy Framework Directive (EU-MSFD) aims to achieve or maintain a

Java for Dummies All-in-One Book ¤ The author of this book is known for an introduction to programming in Java for beginners without special prior knowledge, which he has now updated and expanded with some additional topics. He has retained his partly drastic presentation and clarification through numerous exercises and examples. The book is also suitable for self-study, requires less prior knowledge than B. Burd or K. Günster. The author begins with an introduction to programming and briefly discusses the differences to other programming languages. Then follow the basics of object-oriented and modular programming, window and graphics programming (with Swing or Java FX) and data storage. Remarks on networks and the internal are at the end. The detection and elimination of errors are also well considered. Didactically well constructed. At the end of many chapters, there is a comprehension check through special tasks

Handling of TA Air at Animal Husbandry Facilities: A Guide for Practice ¤ The Technical Instructions on Air Hygiene (TA Air) defines a wide range of requirements that must be taken into account when granting permission for animal husbandry facilities. The regulations not only include requirements for reducing and limiting emissions of odors, ammonia, and dust. To protect the environment, certain emission values or minimum distances to protective goods such as sensitive plants and ecosystems and the neighborhood must also be observed. The present writing is a practice-oriented, technically-legal guide through the regulations of the TA Air. It serves to facilitate handling with it and provide assistance for application at animal husbandry facilities. For the solution of possible problems, the interpretation spaces of the TA Air are shown and useful background information is given. At the same time, however, deficits and conflict potentials are also pointed out, as not all standard applications lead to sensible solutions. [...] (Source: KTBL)

Technical Optics in Practice : with 20 Tables ¤ In this book, experts from research and practice compile the different aspects of classical geometric optics and modern fiber optics and optoelectronics in a compact form. Through application- and implementation-related chapters, the authors provide a high degree of practical utility. As a result, the book makes a significant contribution to the education and further education of students and engineers. The high importance of compact light sources for optical technologies has been taken into account in the new edition with a chapter on "New Lasers". TOC:Geometric Optics.- Wave Optics.- Image Errors and Optical Systems.- Development of Optical Systems.- Optical Materials.- Specifications and Production of Optical Components.- Optoelectronic Components.- Fibers and Sensors.- Lasers.- New Lasers.- Subject and Author Index

Taschenbuch der Mathematik : [with CD-ROM DeskTop Bronstein] ¤ The new book edition with CD-ROM, announced in the review of the 6th edition (BA 11/05), is now available and costs exactly 10 EURO more. Like the 5th edition (BA 2/01), it contains the entire book content as a networked HTML structure with special search functions. The CD-ROM does not need to be installed. (1 A,S) (LK/M: Seide) The standard work contains the entire mathematical knowledge stock in compact and clear form for study and professional practice (engineers, natural scientists). (LK/M: Seide)

Practice Book Differential Equations for Dummies : [Practice makes perfect! ; At a Glance: ordinary differential equations, polynomials, matrix and Co.; Exercises for simple and complex problem statements; Step by Step - the best solution paths; detailed solutions and understandable explanations] ¤ The practice book for "Differential Equations for Dummies" (BA 10/09) provides numerous examples and exercise tasks for solving ordinary differential equations (1st and higher order, systems of linear differential equations 1st order) with detailed solutions. The modular structure follows that of the basic work. In the introduction to each section, the essential is explained briefly and very clearly again. The author conveys numerous solution techniques from the method of undetermined coefficients to series solutions up to the Laplace transformation through a representation of the solution procedures and solutions, which explain all essential individual steps. No theoretical backgrounds, only application of solution procedures. Very nice: the "Top-Ten-Part", which provides 10 common solution methods and 10 applications on a few pages with further Internet links. In addition to the basic work or with sufficient prior knowledge also without this, suitable for students of technical or scientific subjects, possibly also for secondary level II. (2 pages)

Kristallography : an introduction for students of natural sciences ¤ Introduction -- The crystalline state -- The crystal lattice and its properties -- Crystal structure -- Morphology -- The symmetry principle -- The 14 translation (Bravais) lattices -- The 7 crystal systems -- Point groups -- Space groups -- Symmetry groups -- Basic concepts of crystal chemistry -- X-ray investigations of crystals -- Crystal defects -- Appendix -- Solutions to exercise problems -- Literature, subject index, table (Wulff's net)

Brand Design : Strategies for the Digital World ¤ Name, Logo, Claim, Color, Font, Visual World, Sound and Language ensure the recognition of a brand in the market. But do the codes also apply in the digital world? How does a brand succeed in adapting to the media-specific aesthetics of Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, and Snapchat? What happens when people interact with things on the internet through language and movement? The handbook illuminates all aspects of the current challenges. The focus is on knowledge transfer: in addition to the latest findings from consumer research, innovative solutions and best cases are explained in a practical and comprehensive manner by renowned experts. The topics: Communication Design, Corporate Design, Experience Design, Screen Design, Strategic Brand Management

Supplements and Deeper Insights to Arens et al., Mathematics ¤ Supplements and Deeper Insights as bonus material to the introductory university textbook for first-semester students of non-mathematical disciplines ("Mathematics", BA 12/08) especially on linear algebra, analysis, and probability theory. Also available as a pdf file on the internet. - For the completion of the textbook. (2)

Amazon : the book as prey ¤ Although the online retailer Amazon has not even existed for 20 years, it has already revolutionized the shopping habits of people. Customers appreciate its affordable and almost complete product range, independent product reviews from other buyers, and uncomplicated return options. And since the company usually promises delivery by the next working day, many prefer the convenient mouse click to the stressful shopping experience. However, the appearance of the beautiful new world of goods deceives. Behind the facade of Amazon's online shop, a world of precarious working conditions is hidden. The low price for comfortable online shopping is paid by those who are responsible for logistics and shipping of goods. A lot has been published about Amazon in recent times. The present paperback is a good, perhaps necessary supplement to B. Stone: "All Sellers" (ID-A 48/13), R. Brandt: "A Click" (ID-B 31/13), C. Knop: "Amazon knows you already" (ID-B 31/13). Leisegang is editor of the renowned "Blätter für deutsche und internationale Politik", his book appears in a small, left-wing publishing house. The author demands clearly: "Amazon must be stopped and limited in its scope", so that books and book trade can survive. Critically, he comments in small chapters on the precarious working conditions of employees, Amazon's data collection frenzy, the misuse of subsidies, and the exploitation of tax loopholes. Leisegang thoroughly documents his sources. A timeline, graphics, and tables round off the volume. (2) (Martin Eichhorn)

3D Printing : how the generative manufacturing technology works ¤ How does 3D printing work? Which 3D printing technology is suitable for what? What does 3D printing mean for the individual? What societal and economic changes will it bring through this future technology? The author provides answers to these questions. She introduces precisely and simply into the increasingly popular technology of 3D printing. The readers are thus enabled to apply 3D printing themselves. They learn to try out free software or perhaps even use a 3D printer themselves in one of the increasingly numerous open workshops (FabLabs).

Physics: An Introduction for Engineers and Natural Scientists ¤ The foundations of physics - concise, illustrative, and precise. Over 400 illustrations and numerous examples from everyday life promote understanding of physical relationships. The didactics developed in dialogue with students is supported by the appealing two-color layout and facilitates learning. Over 300 comprehension questions and exercises with answers in the appendix encourage independent engagement with the topic. The work is not only excellent for exam preparation. Due to the comprehensive index, it is also recommended as a reference work. On his website, the author offers interesting links, animations, and comprehension questions with commented solutions for download in addition to the individual book chapters. In the 7th edition, the book was printed in full color for the first time. As a result, corrections and additions could be incorporated into all chapters. The electrodynamics was aligned more strongly with the needs of natural science study programs. "A dry subject"...is the verdict of most students on physics. With even greater pleasure, you will take this textbook in hand. The content: Basic concepts. - Mechanics of rigid bodies. - Mechanics of deformable bodies. - Mechanical vibrations and waves. - Heat theory. - Electrodynamics. - Optics. - Atomic and nuclear physics. The target group: Students with physics as a minor subject. The author Ulrich Harten: After his promotion in the field of surface physics, the author was initially employed at the Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt and then at the BASF AG. For 20 years, he has been a professor of physics and mathematics at the University of Mannheim and heads the Institute for Mathematical and Natural Science Foundations there.

The Ancient World and the Sea ¤ The ancient culture was a coastal culture and has always been shaped by the struggle with the sea. Maritime trade enabled the spread of urban civilization. War at sea helped the Athenian democracy to break through. The conquest of the sea was a prerequisite for the emergence of the Roman Empire, enabled the unification of Greek-Roman civilization and the spread of Christianity. The search for fame and wealth finally motivated Mediterranean sailors to venture into the oceans and to consider a journey to India over 1000 years before Columbus. Raimund Schulz describes the driving forces that drove the Greeks and Romans again and again to the sea, and clears up numerous legends and prejudices like that of the alleged sea-hostility of the Romans. He describes the essential stages of the

Shadows of Play - Technology Shapes Everyday Life ¤ The use of technology was until the widespread dissemination of information and communication technologies associated with the idea of a purposeful use of means. This has changed with the use of computer technology. More often, personal, social, aesthetic, and playful dimensions come to the forefront. The use of modern gadgets (smartphone, PC-tablet & Co.) with their versatile possibilities is of a playful nature and conceals so efforts and time expenditure. Modern technology use appears to be self-determined. In increasing numbers, members of society make temporal, financial, and social expenditures to be constantly reachable and ready for action. One of the consequences of technological everyday action is a stronger emphasis on the
Verblüfft?! : Mathematical Proofs of Unbelievable Ideas ¤ A mix of surprising things with clever solutions

Fassadenöffnungen ¤ Series for beginners in architecture and civil engineering, externally reminiscent of study scripts and offering a clear introduction to the subject (cf. most recently B. Bielefeld, K. Jormakka, H. Klein et al.). The present title deals with the constructive and stylistic design of windows as central openings in facade design. The various requirements (protection function, air and light permeability, interface in energy-saving planning), construction basics, as well as the different components, types, materials, and the constructive connection to the wall surfaces are conveyed. Typically equipped with small-format black-and-white photos, numerous construction drawings, practical tips, hints, and further literature references. For the target group, a recommended supplement to the more expensive example collection by U. Baus: "Openings" (ID 41/06). (3)

Facebook - Marketing among Friends : Dialogue instead of Blunt Advertising ¤ Advertising on and with Facebook, a guide for small and medium-sized enterprises, with many examples of successful strategies and campaigns

Options for the Import of Green Hydrogen to Germany until 2030: Material Volume ¤ Hydrogen is a key element to achieve climate neutrality. Especially for the decarbonization of industry and certain transport sectors, it represents an important complement to direct electrification. To cover the future high demands, imports will be necessary. It is about learning from the past and minimizing dependencies. The ESYS experts show in an analysis transport options and their advantages and disadvantages, and describe obstacles and challenges for the build-up of transport chains and hydrogen cooperations.

Windows 10 for Dummies : [set the tone on your Windows 10 PC ; at a glance: get to know the new features of Windows 10 ; adapt Windows 10 to your needs ; with many step-by-step instructions and helpful illustrations ; completely in color] ¤ In the widely established Dummies series, an output is now available for Microsoft's operating system Windows 10. Rathbone was also responsible for numerous predecessor versions (most recently Windows 8.1, ID-A 13/14; Windows 8, ID-A 4/13). The design and content preparation offer the familiar picture. The 21 chapters contain all the knowledge for the beginner or switcher. Apart from the bracketed installation questions, traditional topics (Desktop, window techniques) are treated equally, as well as the handling of apps and the use of social contacts. The topic of security falls rather briefly, on the other hand, multimedia (music, photos, films) receives sufficient attention. This also applies to the treatment of problems and error messages. Overall, a more text-oriented representation with some colored screenshots and hint pictograms. In addition to the aforementioned editions, it is well suited. I. Baumeister (ID-A 39/15) and I. Schels (ID-A 41/15) rely more on a visual mediation. (1) (LK/HB: Isigkeit) Introduction to the operating system for beginners and switchers. The handling of the modified system is explained and all important functions are presented. The import of data from mobile devices is also taken into account. (LK/HB: Isigkeit)

Modulated Surfaces : Ornament and Technology in Contemporary Architecture ¤ A trend topic and its constructive foundations: the ornament in current architecture. The ornament is currently gaining a new value in architecture. Innovative technologies of design and digital component production are changing its role radically, by relating the expressive forms of the ornament to the constructive logic of a building. This opens up a wealth of new interaction possibilities between function and decor, building and surface, structural system and envelope.

Introduction to the Statistical Evaluation of Experiments: Theory and Practice with R ¤ Verl.Beschr.: This textbook provides a variety of tools for the analysis of experiments: It shows the basics of the evaluation of factorial designs using one- or multi-factorial variance analysis (ANOVA) as well as using common non-parametric alternatives. In addition, procedures for checking the assumptions of variance analysis are presented. The individual procedures are first motivated, presented, and worked out with paper and pencil using clear examples and data sets. For larger examples, the freely available statistical software R is used, with which the manual calculations can be traced and finally also larger data sets can be evaluated.

Smart Cities : German High Technology for The City of The Future ¤ The worldwide urbanization is a central challenge of the 21st century. Since 2007, for the first time, more people have lived in metropolitan areas than in rural regions, in 2030 it will be 60 percent. The more so are cities and agglomerations dependent on networked technologies. „Smart“ technologies offer answers in different fields of demand. Just Germany has good chances to establish itself as a leading provider of innovative overall solutions – if the framework conditions are created. The present statement was prepared in preparation for the first „Innovation dialogue between federal government, economy and science“ in September 2010. It represents, however, an independent publication of the German Academy of Science and Engineering. In it, recommendations for action are presented, how the demand for integrated solutions can open up new opportunities for value creation.

The Anarchy of Hackers : Richard Stallman and the Free Software Movement ¤ How anarchist is the hacker ethic? Why does Richard Stallman, one of the most outstanding figures of the Free Software Movement, call himself an anarchist? We must not stereotype the anarchists of free software as chaotic individuals with tousled hair, wild eyes, and arms full of bombs. On the contrary: They demand a new order of intellectual property in the sense of the hacker ethic - Access to knowledge should be free, decentralized, antibureaucratic, and anti-authoritarian.

Idea Book Garden Design : 444 Inspirations for Every Garden Situation ¤ Comprehensive idea book with high practical value. Numerous examples of garden design with descriptions of necessary work, possible legal regulations and approximate costs

Statistics Exercises: Descriptive Statistics, Probability Calculus, Concluding Statistics ¤ Students of economics and social sciences who need basic knowledge of statistics can prepare for their exams with this exercise book. Review (ekz): The author, a professor at the University of Regensburg, has developed this companion volume with exercise tasks and solutions in addition to his two textbooks "Descriptive Statistics" and "Probability Calculus and Concluding Statistics" (Gabler, 8th edition 2013; not discussed here). The publisher also offers the learning software "PC-Statistics Trainer" as free additional material on its website. The exercise book can be used by students with the necessary knowledge for exam preparation independently of the textbooks...(3)

Transformations Management for Sustainable Water Management : Handbook for the Realization of New Infrastructure Solutions in the Field of Water and Sewage ; [Results of the Research Consortium netWORKS] ¤ The transformation - the change - of urban technical systems of water supply and sewage disposal is the subject of this volume. In the sense of an energy- and resource-efficient urban development, it is necessary to raise existing potential in energy and material resources. If this transformation is successful, the urban water infrastructure will be more decentralized and closely linked to the energy infrastructure (especially heat supply) in the future. It will consist of numerous modules, focus on the closure of material cycles, and be able to react more flexibly to changing environmental conditions. It will mainly affect the level of individual households or buildings, as well as the level of individual blocks, and have consequences for building technology and building equipment. The publication of the research consortium netWORKS is aimed at decision-makers from the fields of urban development, urban planning, and urban water management. Responsible planners are given a concept for a multi-dimensional evaluation of possible transformation strategies.

Warehouse Management : Automation and Organization of Warehouse and Commissioning Systems ¤ Warehouse Management Systems are state-of-the-art in internal material flow control. In addition to the elementary functions of a warehouse management, such as quantity and storage space management, conveyor medium control and disposition, methods and means for controlling system states as well as operational and optimization strategies also belong. The book is accompanied by a CD-ROM with a fully functional WMS (Open Source). The associated simulation environment enables autonomous operation on a standard PC (Windows). TOC:Management of warehouse systems.- Basics of warehouse and conveyor technology.- Material flow automation.- Automatic identification.- Information and communication technology.- Implementation of warehouse management systems.- Setting up WMS as an example of myWMS.- Abbreviation index.- Bibliography.- Index.

Computer Science Exam Trainer : 500 Questions and Answers for the Bachelor's Degree ¤ Exam trainers from the Spektrum publishing house have often been discussed (e.g. R. Busam: ID 14/08 - Analysis; C. Turtur: ID 8/08 and ID 23/03 - Mathematics). The present book addresses students of computer science at universities of applied sciences and universities who want to prepare for the bachelor's examination in particular. It is assumed that students have acquired basic knowledge in their studies. Facts that are important for the examination are worked out, which are experienced to be important. In the foreground are questions on applications, but also the basic understanding of important concepts is not neglected. The facts are conveyed in the question-answer style. The very detailed answers often bring short examples and references to further literature. The book is divided into 3 large sections: theoretical computer science, practical computer science, and technical computer science. Emphasis is placed on formal languages and automata theory, algorithms, and circuits/circuit works. Recommended especially for university libraries. Replaces no textbook, but can also support self-study well. (2)

The Sketchnote Handbook : the illustrated guide to creating visual notes ¤ Sketchnotes, composed of the two words "sketch" (English: sketch) and "note" (English: note) are notes that consist of images, texts, and structures. In particular, when it comes to images, it's not about creating refined drawings, but rather sketch-like representations that resemble a draft. With sketchnotes, you can visualize matters, develop thoughts and concepts, and unlock themes. They can also be used in addition to protocol management during lectures and courses. Sketchnotes can be created conventionally with pen and paper, but also digitally using corresponding apps. In digital form, they are often communicated and shared via social media channels. American designer and "Sketchnote Guru" Mike Rohde describes what sketchnotes are, what they can be used for, and above all, how to create them. In addition, he presents various types, as well as skills and techniques for creating sketchnotes. An animated title with little text and many sketchnotes

Introduction to Mechatronics ¤ In recent years, the increasingly stronger penetration of mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, and computer science has led to the formation of a new discipline, mechatronics. In this interdisciplinary field of engineering sciences, independent fields such as design engineering, technical dynamics, modeling, measurement, control, and regulation engineering, drive engineering, microprocessor engineering, and computer science come together. After an overview of the affected areas of this discipline, the interlocking of the areas in typical mechatronic products is presented using examples

Introduction to Mathematics and Computation Methods : for Students of Physics and other Mathematical and Natural Sciences ¤ The textbook, based on long-standing experience in university teaching, provides students of physics and related natural sciences with an application-oriented presentation of the canonical topics of introductory mathematics events treated in the first year of study. The work, equipped with numerous examples and explanatory illustrations, is consistently oriented towards the target group. In favor of a presentation that consistently orients itself to the application possibilities and scientific relevance, and deliberately originates from the perspective of a physicist, a stringent deductive and complete proof development of concepts, methods, and concepts is waived. The modular design allows for a punctual access to specific contents. The target group is also useful in conjunction with the more comprehensive and methodologically differently constructed work by H. Kerner (ID-G 13/06) and in addition to the work by Christian B. Lang (ID-G 2/06). With tasks and complete solutions. (3) (Philipp Kastendieck) The textbook provides students of physics and related natural sciences with an application-oriented presentation of the canonical topics of introductory mathematics events treated in the first year of study. (Philipp Kastendieck)

Handbook for Technical Product Design: Material and Manufacturing; Decision-Making Foundations for Designers and Engineers ¤ At the interface between product development/design and engineering, communication and cooperation deficits sometimes occur, which can significantly negatively affect the efficiency and quality of development and innovation processes. The causes include, among other things, competence gaps regarding technical relationships on the part of design professions and creative service providers. Corresponding specialized literature, in which basic technical know-how is prepared and conveyed across disciplines on the basis of semantics and the potential of designers, is not yet available on the market. The present book aims to close this gap. In development processes, frequently used technical knowledge about materials and possible processing methods is presented in a clear and scientifically founded manner in the form of a comprehensive reference work, in a way that addresses and supports the way of thinking of designers/engineers and representatives of design professions. Through a corresponding form of presentation, it should be possible to inform oneself quickly and comprehensively about the most important technological framework conditions for a design. In this process, visual and intuitive reading aids have been introduced, and the knowledge components within the book have been linked to each other. TOC:Introduction: History of mass production.- Selected products and their manufacture.- Materials.- Processing methods.- Restrictive design.- Basics of various disciplines.- Cost accounting & business administration.- Design theory.- Dictionary.- Library of materials and their surfaces, company register.- References.
Wall Lexicon : the most important surfaces for the interior ¤ In a comparable format to the

Textile finishing by innovative joining processes for the industrial production of textile-reinforced concrete elements : KoTexBet ; within the BMBF research program "Building and Living" on the topic of joint projects for the development and testing of new building methods and techniques : Final report of the joint project ¤ Contains final reports of the Institute for Textile Technology of RWTH Aachen, the Institute for Massive Construction of RWTH Aachen (= Institute Report No. 159/2006) and the Institute for Joining and Welding Technology of TU Braunschweig

Scientific Works with Microsoft Office Word 2010 : [everything under control: templates, graphics, diagrams, and indexes ; the 'outer values': perfect layout for home works, diploma works, dissertations & Co. ; the form true: formal requirements easily implemented] ¤ This guide to creating scientific works with Word 2010 on the basis of the Windows 7 operating system is an updated and revised version of the previous edition for Word 2007 (BA 8/07). Since the differences between the new Word version and the predecessor are not so pronounced, parts of the text remained unchanged. A stronger emphasis is placed on visual effects. In contrast, the 2nd chapter, which dealt with the creation of outlines and central and branch documents, has been omitted. The depth of the table of contents has been shortened, but a targeted access to contents is possible via the index. Images have been replaced and the accompanying CD contains all mentioned examples and templates. The new edition can be provided in addition to the still usable pre-edition and as a more affordable alternative to the more comprehensive representations by M. Hahner (BA 12/09) and N. Nicol (6th edition: BA 1/08; Word 2010 edition to be reviewed). (2) (LK/HB: Isigkeit) Easy-to-understand guide to creating scientific works with Word 2010. (LK/HB: Isigkeit)

Integrated Information Management : Strategies and Solutions for IT Service Management ¤ This book is aimed at IT managers and IT consultants. The reader receives a practice-oriented overview, especially but also solution proposals for the successful management of his information technology. In the first part, six current trends and challenges in information management are described. In the second part, a comprehensive model for integrated information management is presented, which is an answer to Part 1. The individual components of the model are presented. In the third part, six concrete examples are described, how selected concepts of integrated information management can be implemented in practice. The basis of the book is the transfer of successful management concepts from industrial production to IT management. The contents of the book have emerged from a competence center that is operated by the University of St. Gallen with a series of well-known large companies. The examples described in the book are largely the results of concrete pilot projects that were implemented in the partner companies of the competence center.

Southeastern Europe : The Small Subcontinent ¤ In contributions illustrated with color photographs, posters, and maps, journalists, scholars, and politicians draw a multifaceted picture of the current political and social situation in Southeastern Europe. Review: The large-format special issue of Le Monde diplomatique (co-published with taz, last issue: Russia, 2013) contains 23 short, illustrated essays, in which journalists, scholars, and politicians draw a multifaceted picture of the political and social situation in Southeastern Europe. This includes political contributions on border demarcations, EU and NATO experiences, as well as essays on the Southeastern European participants in the European Song Contest, environmental activism in Bulgaria, and the tradition of Islam in Bosnia, or on Dacia production in Romania and the importance of economic migrants for Moldova. In addition, there are listings, for example, on Nobel laureates, human rights violations, etc. A varied potpourri, without claim to completeness, but optically inviting and mostly readable with a journalistic reporting style, which can make curious about this region with informative insights into current problems and living conditions. Without bibliography and index. (2 pages) In contributions illustrated with color photographs, posters, and maps, journalists, scholars, and politicians draw a multifaceted picture of the current political and social situation in Southeastern Europe. (Engelbrecht Boese)

The Silent Satellites : Stories ¤ A locomotive driver who loves night shifts until a laughing man stands on the tracks. A guard who makes his rounds around the foreigner's residence and falls in love with the woman behind the fence. A food stand owner who stands at the high-rise window and looks at the shining satellites of the night. Confidently, boisterously, and dreamily secure, Clemens Meyer tells of lost battles and overwhelming desires. These are stories from our time, as torn apart as our lives, as dark as the world, as beautiful as the most beautiful hopes. "He is considered a hard dog, but in his new story collection

The Dynamics of Europe ¤ The European Union has so far expanded in concentric circles. Integration and expansion have mutually reinforced each other. This development is currently facing limits. Internal limits manifest themselves as problems of political will formation, external limits as increasing contradiction between integration and expansion of the EU. The theory of the dynamics of Europe is developed from the current crisis of EU expansion. This theory forms the framework to discuss central problems of the EU: EU development perspectives after the end of its expansions, the transition to the mode of gradual integration, the question of Turkey's accession, the redefinition of the EU's external relations and the further sphere of interest of Europe.

iPod and iTunes for Dummies : [Bringing technology to the i-point ; for Mac and Windows users ; import music, send pictures, play videos ; the iPod as an organizer] ¤ The American original has been available for over 4 years (now in 5th edition), now also appears in our "Dummies" guide to the classic MP3 player and its software. The authors, experienced in PC, multimedia and desktop publishing (ID 47/87), have brought together all the relevant information on the subject. After a general introduction, in 4 parts - "Set up and obtain media content", "Manage media content", "Play the iPod", "Advanced" - many practical information is offered, in addition there is the obligatory final chapter with further tips, troubleshooting and solutions to 10 problems. The schema is well known, there are many sub-chapters, supplemented by good illustrations and highlighted additional notes by pictograms. With all the expertise: The tone is relaxed, the explanations are understandable and the numerous step-by-step instructions are well understandable. Despite numerous competing titles (most recently the Ullstein pocket book "iPod", BA 5/07, and Scott Kelby: "iPod - the book", BA 10/07) for all. (1

Elementary Stochastics : a Learning Book - Developed by Students ¤ Publisher's text:This textbook presents the most important concepts of elementary stochastics, and it becomes clear that they have a close relationship to

Embedded Linux : with Raspberry Pi and Co. ¤ Under Embedded Linux one understands an almost invisible operating system on a Linux basis without a pronounced user interface, which regulates the monitoring, control, and data processing of technical devices. With this topic (also based on the Raspberry Pi) J. Quade has already dealt with it, who has dealt with the importance of Embedded Linux in the programming of real-time operating systems in "Modern Real-Time Systems ...". The author introduces in the present book the operation and the ongoing development of Embedded Linux. Readers with good knowledge in C are addressed, who want to get more out of existing Embedded Linux systems. Briefly, alternative uses based on other minicomputers are mentioned. The author begins briefly with the basics of installation and data exchange between host and embedded system and then comes to the construction of a kernel and the basics of driver development based on practice examples. Good information source; each chapter with an overview of further literature

Bugatti : Passenger and Racing Cars since 1910 ¤ Provides an overview of passenger and racing cars of the renowned company from 1909 onwards. Roughly chronologically ordered by type, with systematic short descriptions, data tables, black-and-white and colour photos. Affordable compilation for a broad enthusiast circle. Suitable as a replacement for "Bugatti" (ID 28/91), "Bugatti" (ID 3/92, both no longer quite up-to-date) and for J. Kurz (ID 21/05), who illuminates the company and family history even more. (2)

SSH, the secure shell : the definitive guide ¤ The danger of data being intercepted by unauthorized third parties during internet communication is growing in today's communication society. The authors deal with the topic of network security and present various versions of the SSH (Secure Shell) network protocol. SSH offers robust and reliable, TCP/IP-based solutions for various network security problems. The topic was last extensively dealt with by K. Siyan (ID 50/95 - meanwhile outdated). SSH is free software, but also available in various commercial value-added versions for different platforms. The focus of the book lies with UNIX; Windows and other operating systems are treated somewhat shorter. Addressed are system administrators and technically interested readers with prior knowledge (e.g. the UNIX programs rsh, rlogin and rcp). Topics treated include, among others, the login process on remote systems, data transfer between different computers, the creation of "secured" tunnels, and the secure execution of processes on other computers. (3) (Klaus Barckow)

The City from the Modern Era to the 19th Century: Urban Designs in Europe and North America ¤ After his extremely successful history of the city in the 20th century, Vittorio Magnago Lampugnani has now essentially written the precursor to his magnum opus. From the development from the modern era to the 19th century, he highlights the most glorious, but certainly decisive moments and designs a sparkling kaleidoscope of Western urban architecture: From medieval city-states to the urbanistic inventions of the Renaissance and the perspective strategies of the Baroque to the massive modernizations, through which the bourgeoisie adopted the traditional city. Each chapter is dedicated to the architectural form of a European city and its special conditions in a specific era: Florence, Rome, Lisbon, London, Paris, Berlin, Vienna, and Barcelona; in addition, there are North American colonial settlements, pioneer cities, and metropolises. More than 350 predominantly large-format and colored images, city plans, designs, drawings, architectural photographs, aerial photographs, provide an enormous visual pleasure and open a new view on the cities of Europe and North America Italian city-states -- Urban compositions of the Renaissance -- "With truly unbelievable costs and in accordance with the great spirit..." -- Power performances in French absolutism -- The urbanization of North America -- On the way to enlightenment -- Squares, circuses, crescents, improvements -- Embellishment, modernization, and repression -- Cities for ideal communities -- A capital for the high bourgeoisie -- Delayed metropolis Berlin -- The Vienna Ringstrasse -- Ieoogical and scientific urbanism.

Novell Open Enterprise Server - Linux: Network Administration ¤ You want to build and manage a network with Novell OES? Here's how! - Comprehensive Linux know-how for your work as an administrator: * Learn how to install an OES server under Linux and set up eDirectory services. * You will learn everything worth knowing about client integration into the network, creating and managing organizational units, users, and user groups. * We will convey to you the necessary knowledge about the server boot process, file and print services, rights assignment, and authentication.

Airbus : Aircraft since 1972 ¤ The sequentially arranged pocket book records after a brief company history the machines of the largest European aircraft manufacturer. All models are recorded, starting from the first development A300 from 1972 to the military transporter A400M, whose delivery is to begin in 2012. Each aircraft is presented with a color photo, short description, model history, and technical data sheet. A compact, up-to-date, and affordable overview, well suited as an update to Karl Morgenstern: "Airbus" (BA 6/04) or as an addition to general titles like "The Great Book of Commercial Aircraft" by Achim Figgen (BA 7/09). (2)

Upgrade : new living space through extension and renovation ¤ Extension, renovation, demolition. Upgrade breathes new life into old houses, barns, or mountain huts. Upgrade explores how architects and designers skillfully transform our living spaces from small changes to complete renovation processes. Whether it's a converted attic floor, an old factory building that is converted into a modern office and cozy home for a family, or new wooden facades that stand in surprising contrast to old brick walls; Upgrade tells impressive projects and invites you to consider old building substance from a new perspective. A dilapidated barn, a run-down city house, a half-destroyed historical building facade - all this can be the foundation for extraordinary and inspiring architecture. This compendium shows how an old shed becomes a new children's room, how a garage becomes a guest house or an Alpine hut becomes a modern holiday home. And even with a smaller budget, you can create new and desirable things from old walls. The projects in this book demonstrate how existing buildings and materials can be completely reinvented with a little creativity and how modern can be connected with old. Architects report on the challenges that await homeowners and what unsuspected potential lies in old buildings. Before-and-after photos demonstrate the impressive transformations. Upgrade serves as inspiration for all who prefer to preserve rather than destroy

Physics of Atoms and Molecules : an Introduction ¤ The new edition of the classic covers not only the basics but also numerous modern applications, e.g. quantum optics, atom and ion traps, high-precision spectroscopy, atoms in strong magnetic fields, Bose-Einstein condensates etc.

The World of Raw Materials: Deposits, Extraction, and Economic Aspects ¤ Comprehensive description of the formation of deposits and the availability of mineral raw materials (e.g. ores or industrial minerals), fossil energy carriers and bulk materials (rocks and earth). With economic and ecological aspects. (Ingrid Rall-Haiss) The very informative and understandable non-fiction book by the two mineralogists Neukirchen ("Bewegte Bergwelt", ID-A 14/11, "Precious Stones", ID-G 24/12) and Ries explains the world of ores, fossil energy carriers, industrial minerals and bulk materials (e.g. salts, rocks and earth). In the 1st part, different types of deposits and their formation are treated. Important historical (e.g. Black Forest, Harz) but also current deposits worldwide on land and at sea are presented. The 2nd part is organized by raw materials. In addition to formation, properties, use, extraction and processing, it also deals with economic, political, social, historical and ecological aspects. With a clear and balanced representation of the currently much-discussed fracking and the associated risks. Excellent illustrated with numerous photos of mineral stages, exposures and deposits, geological overview maps and graphics. With text boxes and literature references. Other focal points than "Treasures of the Earth" (ID-A 1/11) and "In Focus: Mineral Resources" (ID-B 8/12). Highly recommended. (2 S) (Ingrid Rall-Haiss)

SPSS 18 for Dummies : [decide professionally thanks to professional analyses; at a glance: get to know and safely apply SPSS 18, prepare data professionally and analyze it correctly, present results in a clear and convincing manner, optimize data export to other programs] ¤ Whether customer data or sales figures, survey results or scientific studies - large data sets can be best managed with SPSS, the most frequently used software tool for statistical data analysis. In "SPSS 18 for Dummies" Felix Brosius offers a casually written and at the same time very comprehensive introduction to this so powerful program. Use your data cleverly, make informed decisions based on it and turn disordered data sets into important information sources.

50 Key Ideas Architecture ¤ Wilkinson, known e.g. for the engaging first information "World-Famous Buildings in Detail" (ID-A 9/13), now offers within the established series (lastly "50 Key Ideas digital culture": ID-A 16/13) an introductory title to Western architecture from antiquity to the present, which, despite its brevity in the 4-page articles, is knowledgeable and substantial, not only descriptive but also explanatory. It covers mainly architectural styles and periods, but also terms such as taste or restoration and currents like the Garden City movement. The design with loose text, defining quotes, highlighted information blocks, and a continuous timeline has been retained. The popular scientific work with an attractive cover design complements as an overview well "100 Ideas change - Architecture" (ID-B 50/11), which goes into more detail on the developments that were pioneering at the time, and is on the same level as "Architecture" (Dorling Kindersley; BA 4/07), Christoph Höcker (BA 7/08) and "Milestones - how great ideas changed architecture" (ID-A 27/12). (2 S) StO Art small

Wind Energy Installations and Spatial Planning Areas ¤ Wind energy has the greatest importance among all renewable energy sources in the context of the energy transition. For stable growth, a sufficient supply of plan lawfully secured areas must be available. The contribution focuses on the stock of spatial planning areas for wind power use in regional plans, the density of development and the installed capacity. The basis of the investigation are the spatial planning plan monitor maintained by the BBSR, which contains vector data of spatial planning areas in binding regional plans, as well as a wind turbine database built up by the BBSR with site-specific data. This makes it possible for the first time to perform a nationwide geo-statistical overlap of spatial planning areas and installation locations (Source: Publisher).

Surveying Science and Fundamentals of Statistics for the Construction Industry ¤ The broad field of surveying, which includes satellite and physical geodesy, land surveying, geoinformation systems, and cartography, photogrammetry, real estate and land use planning, as well as cadastral and engineering surveying, must be necessarily limited in the present textbook. The selection of content is primarily oriented towards the surveying tasks associated with the creation of various types of buildings, such as buildings, dams, roads, and bridges, down to machine engineering facilities. Before the start of each construction project, the task is to measure existing conditions and transfer the planned into the location, which cannot be realized without knowledge of surveying procedures and the necessary equipment and instruments. This also includes the application of GPS technology... Standard work for students and practitioners of the fields of surveying and civil engineering, architecture, geography, and the further geosciences (latest 4th, revised edition: ID 10/01 d.Red.) ... (Publisher's text)

Space Knowledge ¤ Illustrated, entertaining, and engaging overview of the most important areas of space travel. Reichl and Koç focus their attention not only on history, scientific foundations, and technology, but also on topics such as space travel as an economic factor, cost-benefit ratio, private space projects, space tourism, and emerging space nations like China, Japan, and India. A detailed table of contents, summaries of important data, and an appendix with statistics make the book very clear and also useful for quick fact-finding. The two authors were long-time employees of the European aerospace conglomerate EADS and have already published a lot of literature on astronomy and space travel (cf. Koç: ID 13/05). A current and successful book on the subject, worth its price - also very suitable for student presentations. Highly recommended before W. Engelhardt (ID 29/01) and alongside the topic brochure for secondary level I (ID 25/05) and the brief representation by G. Siefarth (ID 23/01). (1)

Concrete Mathematics (not only) for Computer Scientists : with many graphics and algorithms in Python ¤ With computer science-specific applications, including cryptography, coding and complexity theory, as well as computer graphics. Supported by many colorful graphics, about 1000 tasks with solutions and not least hundreds of videos in which one can have the read material explained personally by the author again.

Foundations of Functional Analysis ¤ In this book, you will find the foundations of functional analysis, which were developed in the first third of the 20th century. Starting from concrete questions of analysis, you will learn methods for investigating linear operators between Hilbert spaces and Banach spaces and apply them to Fourier series, linear integral and differential equations, and in quantum mechanics. The book is an excellent companion to an introductory lecture on functional analysis and also suitable for self-study. It is very comprehensive and easy to understand, with concepts and results illustrated by numerous examples and illustrations. You can test your understanding of the material through many exercise problems, and develop it further independently through others. Solutions can be found on the book's website at www.springer.de. You only need to have 'Analysis I', foundations of linear algebra and topology of metric spaces, and familiarity with Lebesgue integrals. If necessary, you can refresh many of these prerequisites through the comprehensive appendix. For the present second edition, the work has been thoroughly reviewed to expand some topics and further improve the didactic presentation, especially through more detailed elaborations of many arguments.

Sunny Prospects ¤ Amazon: Sunny Prospects promises a house that is oriented towards a completely new way of living: cut close and yet generous in its effect, comfortable and intelligently controlled, climate-friendly and energy-generating rather than consuming. The Technical University of Darmstadt participated in the international university competition Solar Decathlon in Washington DC in 2009. And for the second time in a row, the German team won first place. The Solar Decathlon serves to bring the potential of solar and sustainable building as well as solar energy generation closer to a broad public. It offers the chance not only to tread new paths in architecture, but also to develop, test, and apply new technologies and products

PORTAL GREEN : Development of a Power-to-Gas Guide for the Integration of Renewable Energies ¤ Storing electricity from renewable energies as hydrogen and using it in a variety of ways: Behind the term Power-to-Gas lies an important technology to achieve climate goals. However, inconsistent guidelines and a lack of experience with the new application cause headaches for those responsible when planning and putting Power-to-Gas plants into operation. Researchers in the Portal Green project offer a guide as a decision-making aid for free download. This guide is intended to serve companies and authorities as a guide, assistance, orientation, and aid, which procedures and laws to observe when they want to build and operate Power-to-Gas (German: electricity-to-gas) plants.

Fascination Construction — Profession and Field of Activity in Change: Recommendations for the Education of Qualified Skilled Workers in Germany ¤ Project -- Introduction -- Seven theses on the education of construction engineers and the profession of construction engineers -- 3 recommendations. Innovation power and high-tech products make Germany one of the leading industrial nations. The development of new and improved products will also play a prominent role in the future, as product development and design contribute to prosperity, economic growth, and international competitiveness in Germany. Behind each new or customer-adapted product is a masterful achievement: technical challenges and needs must be recognized. Suitable technical solutions must be found, which are then further developed into a functioning and industrially producible product. No development project is like the other and with each new one, new territory is entered. These diverse, constantly changing but responsible tasks are often taken over by construction engineers in the mechanical engineering and electrical engineering industries. The education of construction engineers is thus faced with great challenges: it must meet the changing fields of activity and requirements with adapted training concepts, prepare for the handling of continuous development, and at the same time be attractive to potential construction engineer recruits. Based on seven theses, this acatech POSITION sketches the current university education of construction engineers and the profession of construction engineers.
