Mehlmann: 'Who Wins the Game?' (BA 3/98); the new work is just as interesting and well-readable due to numerous digressions and notes. (2)

Introduction to Electrical Measurement Technology : Fundamentals, Measurement Procedures, Devices ; with 12 Tables and 54 Examples as well as 15 Tasks with Solutions ¤ Publisher's text: This textbook conveys the fundamentals and procedures of electrical measurement technology together with its practice-oriented application. After an introduction to basic terms and a general description of the properties of electrical measuring instruments, the measurement principles and procedures for measuring the most important electrical quantities are explained. Structured according to the measurement quantities, the specific features, possibilities, and areas of application of the current measuring instruments are presented for the described analog and digital procedures. The book covers the essential contents of a lecture on the fundamentals of electrical measurement technology, which students of electrical engineering and natural and engineering sciences hear in their basic studies.

Fundamentals of Technical Thermodynamics: Textbook for Students of Engineering Sciences ¤ Thermodynamic basic concepts -- The first law of thermodynamics -- The second law of thermodynamics -- Ideal gases -- Real gases and vapors -- Thermal machines -- Cycles -- Exergy -- Heat transfer -- Moist air -- Combustion.

Demographic Change - State of Knowledge and Recommendations for Ensuring Mobility of Older Road Users ¤ The topic of safety of older road users has developed into an important focus of behavioral research at the Federal Highway Research Institute (BASt). Within various research projects, relevant performance potentials, deficits, health data, and compensation strategies of older road users were investigated, as well as intervention measures to improve their driving competence were worked out. In addition, the BASt was the organizer of the conference

Strategies of Municipalities for their Municipal Housing Stocks: Results of a Municipal Survey; a Project of the Research Programme "Experimental Housing and Urban Planning" of the Federal Ministry of Transport, Building and Urban Development (BMVBS), supervised by the Federal Institute for Building, Urban and Spatial Research (BBSR) in the Federal Office for Building and Spatial Planning (BBR) ¤ Municipal housing companies and stocks have traditionally played an important role on the German housing markets. In connection with realized or planned sales of municipal housing stocks, a lively housing policy discussion has been conducted in recent years. Against this background, the research project "Strategies of Municipalities for their Municipal Housing Stocks" was commissioned by the Federal Ministry of Transport, Building and Urban Development (BMVBS) and the Federal Institute for Building, Urban and Spatial Research (BBSR). The aim of the study was to gain information about the situation and importance of municipal housing stocks as well as about the strategies of municipalities with regard to their municipal housing stocks.

Flooring Lexicon: The Most Important Floor Coverings for Architecture and Design ¤ The large-format reference work provides an excellent overview of the diversity of different floor coverings. Organized by wood (parquet, laminate), elastic floor coverings, mineral coverings (natural stones, artificial stones), tiles (including glass tiles), textile floor coverings, and special coatings, over 500 selected floor coverings are briefly presented - each with color photo, product type, properties, material, name, and manufacturer's note. In addition to classic carpet flooring, linoleum, or Cotto tiles, unusual or special coverings are also included, such as laminate tiles in leather optics, dance floor carpets, sports mats, artificial turf, decorative grass tiles, or interactive light surfaces. Finally, short specialist articles and some reference examples of selected manufacturers are included. Recommended for architects, interior architects, planners, and craftsmen, but also for potential homeowners. Without comparison title. "Floor Coatings" (ID 46/10) and H. Timm: "Floor coverings and floor coverings" (ID 5/10) deal with the planning and execution of floors and floor coverings. (2 A) (LK/KA: Nibbrig) The large-format reference work provides an excellent overview of the diversity of different floor coverings for architects, interior architects, planners, and craftsmen, but also for potential homeowners (LK/KA: Nibbrig)

Self-Evaluation in Vocational Education: Concept, Practice, Limits, Action Needs, Instruments ¤ Reflection and self-evaluation are central elements of professional action on an individual and organizational level. In corporate development processes, self-evaluation proves to be a flexible approach to project quality assurance. The concept of 'self-evaluation' is suitable for process evaluation and the empowerment of individuals, teams, and organizational units. Special features are the application-oriented learning, participation, and frequent feedback from the involved parties. The book contains an education pass, which has been successfully tested in companies

Lasers in Science and Technology ¤ The non-fiction book informs about the basics and application areas of laser technology, provides an overview from the discovery of the laser to its practical application in today's time. (Dirk Reinartz) The author provides an overview of laser technology and its applications in this work. In doing so, the history of the laser is illuminated from discovery to current application. The writing style is fluid, easy to understand, and can be read very well. A keyword index, a list of illustrations, and literature recommendations round off the whole. Since this book partially forgoes depth, it is intended as a reading for technically interested parties who want to gain an overview of the operation of a laser. For students or graduates of this field, T. Graf (ID 24/09) or D. Bäuerle (ID 20/09) are recommended instead. (2) (Dirk Reinartz)

Outlook 2007 for Dummies : [Manage Addresses and Dates ; Keep Important Tasks Always Present ; Build Your Own Contact Database] ¤ The organization and communication program Outlook, referred to by Microsoft as Desktop Information Manager, was last presented in this well-known series 10 years ago (BA 6/97, not available for comparison). With the new Office package 2007, there is now another modernized version of this program, which is presented here in its familiar appearance. Initially, general basics are explained to quickly get familiar with the application. Again, the topic of e-mails takes up a lot of space. From message creation to labeling options to filtering, the beginner learns everything worth knowing. The possibilities offered by the functions notebook, calendar, tasks, and journal are also well considered. The elements RSS feeds, podcast, and blog have been newly introduced. The explanations on the Business Contact Manager and the inclusion of SharePoint Team Services are rather business-like. And the increasingly mobile use of Outlook via Web Access is not forgotten. A successful introduction with somewhat contrasted images. (1)

Mathematics see and understand : Key to the world ¤ Review: This book originated from a series of events at the University of Lüneburg, which aimed to provide an insight into various scientific disciplines. The author represented mathematics. She tries to push back formalism, taking into account gaps in proofs, emphasizing applicability with visually illustrated patterns under the motto "better understanding without calculating than calculating without understanding" in selected areas. This is easily applicable to topics from geometry or graph theory, but also in fields such as, for example, stochastic or number theory, especially targeting cryptography, she leads with appealing ideas. As a supplement, also through moving images, a website is offered. The solutions to the embedded tasks can be found in the appendix. Like O. Deiser: "Basic concepts of scientific mathematics" (BA 7/10), this simpler text can also be recommended to students as a guide for finding a study subject. (2 pages)

QUANTAS 04, Measurements in the Arkona Basin from January 26 to February 13, 2004 ¤ In the winter of 2004, a research cruise was conducted in the Arkona Basin using the Helmsand multi-purpose boat. The research goal was to observe the inflow of salt-rich water from the North Sea and its mixing with the surrounding Baltic Sea water. The mutual penetration of water masses of equal density, but different in salt content and temperature, leads to complex sound speed structures in the near-bottom water layer. As a result, the sound channel loses its ability to transmit signals over long distances. Cruise documentation and data were already collected during the research cruise in a suitable file structure on a computer and written to DVD after the cruise. Due to the possibility of referring back to these data, this cruise report can be limited to main points. (AUT)

Ocean circulation and climate: observing and modelling the global ocean ¤ Ocean circulation and climate: "observing and modelling the global ocean" presents the findings of leading scientists on the knowledge of global ocean circulation after the completion of the "World Ocean Circulation Experiments (WOCE)" investigation phase. WOCE's physical and chemical measurements combined with satellite height measurements have created a data set of unprecedented breadth and accuracy. This data set provides the basis for the development of ocean circulation models and combined ocean-atmosphere circulation models, which serve to understand ocean fluctuations and climate fluctuations and project climate changes. The book leads through the analysis, interpretation, modeling, and synthesis of these data. (MOD)

Young Architects - the Avantgarde ¤ The young international architecture scene has a lot of potential – the ideas are unconventional, but executable. This Callwey book presents over 100 offices that inspire with their spectacular buildings and visions. The approaches and design methods of the new avant-garde are impressively documented using numerous images and plans. A book for everyone who already wants to know today who the stars of tomorrow will be.

Stochastics in Engineering Sciences: An Introduction with R ¤ Introduction to probability theory and statistics for engineers and natural scientists. (LK/SH: Preisler) Based on a lecture script, this introduction to probability theory and statistics for engineers and natural scientists has been created. Part 1 deals with the presentation of concrete questions of stochastics in engineering sciences and descriptive statistics, with data from random processes being evaluated. Part 2 provides foundations for the description of random phenomena and probability theory as well as simulation using the freely available statistics software R. Each chapter closes with exercise problems, solutions, and further R programs are made available online. Suitable for accompanying lectures, self-study, and as a reference work. With further literature in the text and in the appendix. For professional collections. (3) (LK/SH: Preisler)

Unknown Planet : the astonishing diversity of our animal world ¤ The diversity of the lesser-known animal world, captured in breathtaking photographs and numerous information. (LK/KI: Hagen) The promoted entomologist Ross Piper shows on more than 500 fantastic images the zoological diversity of this world and focuses his attention on the less noticed species such as jellyfish, starfish, arthropods or gill slits (only invertebrates in the marine environment). Ultimately, the familiar animals - mammals, birds, crocodiles, lizards, amphibians and fish - make up only about 4% of the approximately 1.5 million known animal species. This title clearly shows that the great diversity of animal species is due to a relatively small number of ancestral lines that share a common plan and a common evolutionary history. Great macro- and electron microscopic images show snails in bold patterns or the hidden beauty of a thick-shelled sea urchin egg. The text contains detailed information on physiognomy, lifestyle, origin and relationships as well as survival strategies. No comparable title known, so a worthwhile acquisition for larger libraries. (3) (LK/KI: Hagen)

Refactoring : How to Improve the Design of Existing Software ¤ Refactoring means the restructuring of the source code of a computer program, where the original program function remains unchanged. The goal of refactoring is, among other things, to improve the testability and extensibility of the program. At the same time, the probability of errors should be minimized. Literature on refactoring has not been discussed so far. This book is the completely revised new edition of the German translation of the English original title by R. Johnson, in which the term "Refactoring" was introduced in 1990. The didactically well-designed book relies on many code examples in JavaScript, although refactoring is not limited to a specific programming language. Emphasis is placed on the general principles of refactoring and the improvement possibilities they offer for programming, the development of reliable tests for refactoring, and the detection of pitfalls in refactoring. Intensively, the simplification of conditions in programs is also treated. (2)

Health Purposes and Human Genetics: Medical Ethical Arguments for the Binding of Predictive Genetic Tests to Health Purposes ¤ With predictive genetic tests, it is possible to obtain information about individuals. The range of this information extends from hints for nutrition counseling to the diagnosis of severe genetic diseases. This spectrum of test forms ranges from those that do not appear to require regulation at first glance to those with a high potential for harm. Currently, the problem is primarily due to the expanding offers for genetic examinations on the internet. An assessment of the regulatory needs of predictive genetic diagnostics is therefore urgently required: The present volume examines the potential dangers and regulatory needs for predictive genetic tests. It does not present its own regulatory proposal, but develops medical-ethical criteria for such regulations. A comprehensive documentation presents existing national and international regulatory approaches and analyzes them.

On the Go - with Navi, Handy & GPS : how to find your way everywhere ¤ The new, working with black-and-white illustrations, relatively affordable series "Digital lifeguide" (2 further titles for review planned: "Home-Media" and "Music digital & everywhere") offers well-understandable, inspiring and useful information on everything that is now possible with digital devices in everyday life and leisure. This volume shows, not too deeply but offering a comparative overview, how to comfortably plan routes with a GPS navigation device, mobile phone, smartphone or PC, navigate with various means of transport or on foot through the city or nature, or how to access your photo archive through geotagging, for example. Geocaching, the outdoor sport, is also treated. The volume is dotted with numerous tips and further web addresses. In principle, current individual titles are already available for all mentioned topics (e.g. lastly T. Bierl: "GPS on the bike", BA 8/10), but those who could not acquire all of them can compensate with this quick information. Not quite up-to-date, more device-related is J. Schieb (ID 48/09). (2) (LK/M: Zimmermann) Overview of hardware and software for navigation, route planning, geotagging and caching with GPS navigation device, mobile phone, smartphone or PC. With black-and-white illustrations, numerous tips and web addresses. (LK/M: Zimmermann)

Assembly in Industrial Production: A Handbook for Practice; with 16 Tables ¤ The assembly portion of industrial production is large and the reserves in terms of improving economic efficiency as well as better working conditions for employees are considerable. Optimized processes are only achieved through well-coordinated assembly components, automation and manual assembly must complement each other. This book offers a complete and systematic representation of the problems of rational assembly. It deals with product design suitable for assembly and organizational forms of assembly, primary-secondary analysis for planning and determining the economic efficiency of assembly concepts, ergonomic design of manual assembly, hybrid and automatic assembly systems including automation components. Chapters on material supply, assembly planning, economic calculation and employee qualification round off the content. New fields of application for large equipment and machines, extensions in hybrid systems, robot deployment, image processing represent the state of the art. Problem areas such as flexibility, part supply, procurement concepts and logistics belong to a comprehensive consideration and are also treated. New sections on extended assembly planning, but also on the topic of employee qualification, round out the picture. The book lays the foundations for the development, design and operation of economically efficient assembly systems. TOC:Development of assembly technology.- Assembly-optimized product design.- Organizational forms of assembly.- Primary-secondary analysis, a method for planning and determining the economic efficiency of assembly concepts.- Manual assembly area small equipment.- Manual assembly area large equipment.- Economic efficiency of manual assembly.- Hybrid assembly systems.- Automatic assembly.- Construction of flexible assembly machines with robot deployment.- Material-part supply in assembly.- Integration/combination of part production-assembly.- Availability of assembly systems.- Planning and economic efficiency.- Economic assembly vs. low-wage countries.- Employee qualification in assembly/assembly craftsmen.-

Vehicle Transmission ¤ Lecture companion for students and engineers of vehicle and mechanical engineering, providing a comprehensive overview of all current transmission technologies in vehicles. Review: The book provides a detailed overview of modern transmission concepts, which are of great importance for driving behavior and comfort, but even more so for exhaust emissions. After the basics, individual transmission forms are presented with text and numerous diagrams, graphics, etc. Finally, some exercises with solutions follow

We Future Seekers : How Germany Will Become Less Fertile ¤ Uns verbindet eine Schizophrenie aus Konsumismus und Postmaterialismus, eine bizarre Mischung aus materieller Sorglosigkeit und sozialem Leistungsdruck, persönlichem Zukunftsoptimismus und diffuser Zukunftsangst, politischer Entfremdung und dem Bewusstsein, dass doch alles nicht so bleiben kann, wie es ist

EDV-Grundwissen : an introduction to the theory and practice of modern computer science ¤ With the revision of the previous edition (BA 5/02) of this standard work, account is again taken of the rapid progress in the IT sector. In addition to numerous details (additions to operating systems and programming), new sections or chapters can also be identified (PCI Express, Instant Messaging, Computer and Security). The areas of networking and access to the Internet have been newly structured. To improve use, the table of contents has been further differentiated and the nomenclature has been adopted into the chapter headings. The also updated bibliography now also lists internet resources. Consequently, the scope of the book has also increased further (60 pages). The concept has not changed, however, as comprehensive and profound computer science knowledge is still conveyed. Also suitable for students in secondary education II. Desirable in many computer collections. Due to the significant changes, the previous edition should be discontinued. (2 pages)

Ergebnisse des Deutschen Mobilfunk-Forschungsprogramms German Mobile Telecommunication Research Programme (DMF) : Bewertung der gesundheitlichen Risiken des Mobilfunks - Health risk assessment of mobile communications ¤ Das sechsjährige Forschungsprogramms wurde vom Bundesamt für Strahlenschutz (BfS) betreut. Das BfS und die Strahlenschutzkommission (SSK) haben übereinstimmend festgestellt, dass das Forschungsprogramm keine Erkenntnisse erbracht hat, die die geltenden Grenzwerte aus wissenschaftlicher Sicht in Frage stellen. Auch konnten die zu Beginn des Deutschen Mobilfunkforschungsprogramms bestehenden Hinweise auf mögliche Risiken unterhalb der geltenden Grenzwerte nicht bestätigt werden. Ein ursächlicher Zusammenhang zwischen elektromagnetischen Feldern unterhalb der geltenden Grenzwerte und unspezifischen Gesundheitsbeschwerden wie z. B. Kopfschmerzen, Schlafstörungen ("Electrosensitivity") was not verifiable.

A Report on Different Vibration Analyses Based on Acoustic and Mechanical Measurements ¤ The volume contains a report on different vibration analyses based on acoustic and mechanical measurements. The measurements were carried out by the Materials Physics Working Group of the Faculty of Maritime Studies under the direction of Prof. Dr. rer. nat. habil. Jürgen Göken. The report covers the following topics: A) Investigations of the strain-dependent damping of the titanium cladding Ti-10V-2Fe-3Al at room temperature B) Acoustic measurements of sound distribution on various organ pipes and on a piano resonator floor using various acoustic detection systems C) Acoustic measurements on board the ferry \

Technical Chemistry: Introduction to Chemical Reaction Engineering; with 47 Tables and 35 Calculation Examples ¤ This textbook is a classic in Chemical Reaction Engineering. For the 5th edition, important data have been updated. A new chapter on Microreaction Technology complements the book, which thus treats this field as a separate chapter in a German-language textbook for the first time. The book can be used as a complete introduction to the subject, ideal for both scientific and practical studies. TOC: Fundamentals.- Tasks.- Economically optimal process management.- Physical and physico-chemical fundamentals.- General mass and heat balances for single-phase reaction systems.- The batch-operated agitated tank (batch reactor) with complete (ideal) mixing of the reaction mass.- Continuous reaction management without back-mixing of the reaction mass (ideal flow tube).- Continuous reaction management with complete back-mixing of the reaction mass in the reactor (continuously operated ideal kettle and cascade).- Comparative consideration of ideal flow tube, continuously operated ideal kettle, and cascade of continuously operated ideal kettles.- The semi-continuous operation of the ideal mixed agitated tank (partial flow operation).- Residence time distribution and mixing in continuously operated reactors.- Chemical reactions in multiphase systems.- Heterogeneously catalyzed reactions.- Non-catalyzed heterogeneous reactions between fluid substances and solids.- Fluid-fluid reactions.- Microreaction technology.- Reaction engineering of polyreactions.- Mathematical appendix

Turbulence and microstructure studies at a shallow sill of a Norwegian Fjord ¤ In autumn 2002, intensive turbulence and microstructure studies were conducted in the Norwegian Sognefjord using a microstructure and turbulence probe (MST probe) to determine the dissipation rate of turbulent kinetic energy in the vicinity of an underwater ridge at the entrance to the fjord. To capture the hydrographic background, accompanying high-resolution measurements were carried out in advance with a towed CTD chain and a shipboard acoustic Doppler current profiler. The comparison with different regimes of oceanic turbulence shows that the measurements are also in line with those from other mixing areas with extreme topography (e.g. in the Strait of Gibraltar and at Stonewall Bank off the coast of Oregon). (AUT)

The C++ Compendium: STL, Factories, Exceptions ¤ The author conveys a practical programming technique in C++ that leads to correct and reusable code, avoiding typical errors. In the individual chapters, the basics and advanced topics in almost all areas of programming under C++ are considered, with which a programmer is confronted in practice. The exact algorithmic-mathematical approach is always in the foreground. The reader is gradually introduced to the problem statements through practical tasks. The advanced programming technique with templates and the detailed examination of the accuracy of calculations are intended to make the importance of mathematical concepts clear and close knowledge gaps. This work is based on practical experiences from 17 years in the development and use of process control systems and 8 years in teaching programming and network and security protocols. TOC:Basics.- Code Reusability.- Library Modules.- Loop and Jump Instructions.- Interface Conventions.- Pointer Ranges.- Fields.- Import.- Operators.- Standard Template Library (STL).- Template Classes.- Container Classes: valarray, vector, Deque, slist and list, hash, set, map.- Algorithms and Containers.- Searching and Sorting.- Useful Tools.- Index Monitoring.- TRACE.- Parameter Strings.- Data Compression.- Multidimensional Fields.- Dynamic Matrices.- Numerical-Mathematical Classes.- Exceptions and Pointer Management.- Factories.- Internal References.- Runtime Problems.- Reference Concept.- Coordination of Processes.- Filter Streams.- Image Processing.- Computer Graphics.- Data Structures and ASN.1.- Number Representations.- Numerical Applications.- Directories

The Best Tips & Tricks for Google Chrome : [the best apps for your Google Chrome ; Facebook, Twitter & Co. always perfectly in view ; error messages: here you will find the suitable solutions] ¤ Google's Chrome had to gain attention alongside the already established browsers Firefox, Opera, and Internet Explorer. This has been achieved. Many find the tidy, unadorned Chrome interface somewhat dull and only use it occasionally. In truth, it has it in itself. It can flourish if one gives it a different design. There are hundreds of them, created by users, but also by artists. The author not only shows where to find them, but has also discovered many other "Extensions" or "Apps", i.e. useful additional features, and leads them in screenshots. But Chrome itself also has many sensible properties that often hide in a context menu that one only finds when one is pointed out, which the author does commendably. The book can be an eye-opener - also for the reviewer - and will ensure that many surfers will now engage with Chrome for the first time and learn to appreciate this browser. (1 S)

Digital and Web Analytics: Evaluating Metrics, Understanding Visitor Behavior, Optimizing the Website ¤ Introduction to the analysis and interpretation of metrics with the goal of optimizing the online presence. First, it is explained how digital analytics systems work and how a data collection is stored and evaluated. A broad space is taken up by observing visitor behavior, the use of content and digital channels. At the end, the website is optimized. (2-3)

Data Analysis with SAS: Statistical Procedures and Their Graphical Aspects ¤ The "Statistical Analysis System" is a program package developed 30 years ago for statistical investigations, which now runs on all common operating systems for mainframe and PC computers. In this volume, which is an extended 2nd edition of the 2004 published work (not discussed), version 8.2 for Windows is taken as a basis. Initially, the authors provide a thorough introduction to the structures and operations of the system, placing great emphasis on the graphical possibilities. Following a brief summary of the core areas of descriptive and inductive statistics, the main part presents a basic and at the same time practical representation of various procedures and applications using SAS. A reader should be fairly familiar with the general mathematical foundations. In addition to students in higher semesters, this is particularly addressed to demanding users of statistical procedures in practice. (3)

Beleuchtungstechnik for Practitioners : Fundamentals, Lamps, Lighting, Planning, Measurement ¤ Review of the 2nd ed. 1997:As one of the most innovative sectors (new lamps, equipment, etc.) within building equipment, and as an important topic in terms of economy, ergonomics, etc., the subject is actually rarely treated. Most comparable titles on the subject are older than the previous edition (BA 11/92), except for B. Weis (ID 18/96):"...after H.R. Ris...". This one seems to contain the most important information just as compactly, and also includes a diskette. The present 2nd edition is expanded by 40 pages, but smaller libraries do not necessarily have to replace the 1st edition, especially if Weis is available, larger ones should rather; an initial acquisition is recommended instead. (2)

The Big Computer Book for Dummies : [at a glance: Windows 7 clever use - safe surfing on the Internet - find everything with Google - send e-mails - manage music, films and photos in an overview - write and design texts with Word 2010 - have the numbers under control with Excel 2010] ¤ Current comprehensive guide for beginners to the most common questions around the PC in the well-known and sought-after "Dummies" series. Divided into 7 thematic complexes, where according to copyright notices, existing "Dummies" titles were referred back to: PC construction and function (Dan Gookin: last BA 8/10), Windows 7 knowledge (Andy Rathbone: last BA 1/10), help with Win-7 problems and system control, music, film and photo management, internet and email use (John R. Levine: last BA 12/10), Google research on the internet as well as Office 2010 basics, Word 2010, Excel 2010 (Peter Weverka: "Office 2010 - everything in one book", to be reviewed). Compared to the previous edition (BA 3/09) consistently updated, adapted to Windows 7 and Office 2010, a few pages expanded at the same price. Recommended as a current supplement to the predecessor. The content-comparable introduction by G. Born: "Computer completely easy" (BA 5/10) relies on colorful visualization, is therefore 5 EUR more expensive. (2) (LK/KA: Nibbrig) Understandable introduction for PC beginners to PC construction and function, Windows 7 operating system, music, film and photo handling, internet and email use, Google research as well as Office 2010 basics. (LK/KA: Nibbrig)

The Hydrogen Boom : [Wish and Reality in the Climate Protection Race] ¤ Romm thoroughly and differentiated examines the possibilities and limitations of the use of hydrogen as an energy carrier in the face of dwindling oil reserves and threatening climate warming. He knows what he's talking about, because the trained physicist served the Clinton government as responsible for hydrogen and fuel cell research and is active in this field. The regional focus of the demanding, relatively easily understandable book is on the USA, which are both enormous energy consumers and major polluters involved in global problems and do too little about it. It becomes clear how difficult and complicated such a revolution in energy supply is to implement! After the easily readable H. Boethius: "The Hydrogen Turn" (BA 6/05) and alongside the mainly technically oriented Sven Geitmann: "Hydrogen & Fuel Cells" (last ID 51/05) as a comprehensive overview in content, highly recommended. A lot of interesting details can be found, such as the role of Iceland as a possible hydrogen pioneer. (3)

Radio Diversity via Satellite: How to Receive It! ¤ Television reception via satellite is widely available, whereas radio reception is less common, offering a wide range of programs in some cases with excellent sound quality. The author, known through several books on the topic of satellite reception (BA 6/03, 9/02, 7/02 etc.), deals with radio reception in this volume, from technology to the extensive program offer, which is constantly being expanded. A good understanding of technical questions characterizes the book, and a large number of photos enable even laymen to, for example, connect to the HiFi system without problems. The technically experienced reader will appreciate the program tables. The author reports on the antenna systems and their installation in the aforementioned books. (2)

Telecommunication in the new federal states : business and spatial effects since 1990 ¤ After German reunification, the significant infrastructural differences between the two state halves were the greatest obstacle to a rapid convergence of living conditions and economic structures between East and West. This also applied to telecommunications. With a large-scale investment program, the telecommunications infrastructure in eastern Germany is being expanded. The study deals with the spatial and economic effects of telecommunications in the new federal states, using selected economic branches in four case study regions as examples. Its results are based on literature analyses, expert interviews, oral and written surveys of the responsible Telekom service departments, a written survey of 459 companies, and in-depth interviews in 42 selected companies.

Concept of the Federal Environment Agency on Climate Policy: Necessary Adjustments 2009 ¤ The Federal Environment Agency (⁠UBA⁠) presents its concept for climate policy here. We want to show with this how we envision the further steps of an ambitious energy, climate protection, and climate adaptation policy.

Future Market Synthetic Biofuels : Case Study Commissioned by the Federal Environment Agency within the Research Project "Innovative Environmental Policy in Key Areas of Action" (Project Identification Number 206 14 132/05) ¤ Synthetic biofuels, together with bioethanol produced from lignocellulose fermentation, belong to the second generation of biofuels. Characteristic of these biofuels is that the entire plant mass is used for their production, including cellulose, hemicellulose, and lignin. In the fermentative biomass breakdown, ethanol is produced as a product. With the thermochemical biomass breakdown, the so-called BtL (Biomass-to-Liquid) process, synthetic biofuels are produced. In the first process step, the carbon-hydrogen framework of biogenic raw materials is thermally opened to syn gas. Syn gas is a mixture of carbon monoxide (CO) and hydrogen (H2). The second process step uses the purified syn gas for chemical fuel synthesis. The synthesis can be tailored to produce gasoline, diesel fuel, or designer fuels for advanced fuel-efficient and low-emission engines.

50 Key Ideas in Mathematics ¤ This 1st volume of a new textbook series follows a uniform schema. Each topic is treated on 4 pages, always with a striking headline, a text that often starts with a historical example, is often supported by some graphics, and closes with a guiding sentence for the topic, which is always rather ugly printed in the text "What it's about". The 4-page concept naturally leads to bite-sized information, which can lead to a basic understanding of many of the described ideas and can also lead to the reading of more specialized books in the library. This applies, for example, to the 4-color problem, the golden ratio, the normal distribution, fractals, or the importance of zero. The author is a renowned mathematician with a special interest in the history of mathematics and has presented here a nice box of pralines that contains many flavors and will please every reader with some background knowledge. (2)

Perspectives of municipal actors on climate adaptation to heat : Results report of the actor and governance analysis as well as recommendations for action for municipalities ¤ This survey report was created within the framework of project 7 of the BMBF collaborative research project „HeatResilientCity - Heat-resilient urban and neighborhood development in large cities - Resident-oriented knowledge generation and implementation“.

Android-Apps entwickeln : Concept, Programming and Marketing; from Design to Publishing on Google Play and Co.; so develop native Apps for Android; Developing is not enough: Marketing Apps correctly ¤ Apps for Android, an open-source operating system for mobile devices of market-dominating importance, are becoming increasingly important for the two major app stores of Apple and Google. A good introduction to programming these apps for beginners is given by D. Louis (ID-A 4/13); a comprehensive compendium is R. Meier (ID-A 49/13). The present book recommends itself through additional extensive explanations also for the marketing of these apps. Addressed are beginners without greater prior knowledge. The 1st chapter deals with the differences that need to be taken into account when programming for mobile devices compared to programming for desktop devices and servers. The 2nd chapter deals with the actual programming (in Java) and the tools required for this (Android Studio, Android SDK), supported by examples. The 3rd chapter is concerned with marketing (app store optimization, targeted advertising, search engine optimization). The testing on an emulator or the own smartphone is also well considered. Didactically well constructed. Many code excerpts and illustrations. (2) (Klaus Barckow) Introduction to programming Android apps with Java, which also provides hints for marketing these apps. (Klaus Barckow)

The Notebook Handbook : Mobile, Windows, Internet, Wireless, Multimedia, Software, Accessories ¤ Laptops are becoming increasingly powerful and are finding widespread use both as mobile PCs and as a space-saving desktop alternative. A comprehensive guide specifically for this purpose was recently presented (Jürgen Borngießer: BA 6/05), with the present one going even further in terms of content. In 8 chapters, everything is covered that needs to be known - hardware and software, basics, main areas of application and optimization and tuning options - where, in addition to the clear division, the understandable explanations, like the illustrative illustrations and the useful additional tips, convince. While there are always topics that apply to all types of computers, the experienced and versatile author (cf. BA 6/05; 9/05) has succeeded in highlighting the specifics of laptops in particular or incorporating them. A CD-ROM with a bootable rescue operating system, helpful tools and further information completes the suitable book for working through and looking up, which offers a comprehensive and useful guide for beginners and should stand alongside the aforementioned title. (1)

How Germany Can Become the Lead Provider for Electromobility: Status Quo - Challenges - Open Questions ¤ Outlines of future mobility -- Electric mobility systems (drives) -- Chemical energy storage (battery research) -- Power supply infrastructure -- Standardization and normalization -- Value creation -- Education. According to the plans of the federal government, one million electric vehicles are to drive on Germany's roads by 2020 and turn the Federal Republic into an international lead market. What hurdles need to be taken to make Germany not only a lead market, but also an international lead provider of marketable electromobility? What time horizon is realistic in this case? In which fields do opportunities exist for the research and technology location to use electromobility for sustainable growth? The present volume provides answers to these questions and is a status report on the chances, challenges, and open questions of electromobility.

Mathematics for Engineering Studies ¤ Verl.Beschr.: Mathematical Foundations finally understandable This book contains the mathematical foundations of a technically oriented study program. All essential topics are combined in one volume. The form and content are tailored to the specific requirements of a Bachelor's program. The book is suitable for self-learning accompanying lectures. All examples contain a detailed calculation path with many intermediate steps and illustrations. Numerous tasks for understanding, calculation techniques, and applications serve to deepen and prepare for exams. Access to mathematical matters is achieved through understandable derivations, colorful graphics, and carefully selected examples. Much emphasis is placed on clarity and transparency in structure and language. A small formula collection and short portraits of some notable mathematicians in the appendix round off the presentation. Solutions to the tasks are available on the authors' internet pages

MATLAB kompakt : [MATLAB and Simulink examples] ¤ MATLAB is widely used in the natural and engineering sciences as well as in industry for calculations and simulations with graphical representation of results, which is updated twice a year. The comprehensive handbook of experienced MATLAB trainer W. Schweizer (1st edition: ID-G 52/05, Release 7.0) is now available in a significantly expanded and updated version. The representation is now based on version 8.0 (Release 2012b), but also deviations that the previous versions brought with them are taken into account. On the subject recently: A. Bosl: "Introduction to MATLAB, Simulink" (ID-G 35/12, suitable for beginners, cheaper but also less comprehensive); the classic "MATLAB - Simulink - Stateflow" (7th edition: ID-G 4/12, gives greater space to graphical extensions); "MATLAB and Simulink" by O. Beucher (ID-G 24/13, presented as a cheaper, one-week introduction course). (3) (LK/SH: Gülck) Comprehensive handbook for the use and programming of the calculation and simulation environment "Matlab". (LK/SH: Gülck)

Homer's Wild West: The Historical-Geographical Rebirth of the Odyssey ¤ Heinz Warnecke brings Homer's Odyssey back from 'literary abstraction' into historical reality and thereby initiates a paradigm shift in Homer philology. He resolves, taking into account all the statements of the Homeric epics, the question of Odysseus' homeland island and, on a solid philological basis, shows that Odysseus' fictional journey leads through geographical spaces that lose nothing of their reality in the form of mythologizing narration. Furthermore, the historical findings on the subject matter are groundbreaking for the solution of the Homeric question. Moreover, the historical personality of the Odyssey poet and his homeland can now be reliably fixed. In addition to a wealth of new arguments, Warnecke supplements the second edition with a chapter on the history of the Ithaka question.

The Golden Age of Aviation ¤ The airplane has become a mass transportation means today. With budget airlines, it is possible to reach distant destinations for little money. However, from the late 1940s to the 1970s, flying was an exclusive pleasure for wealthy people, who were also offered a perfect service, good food, comfortable seats, and in first class even a bar. Journalist Borgmann draws a comprehensive picture of this - also due to the good profits of the companies - "golden" era. He describes the transition from propeller planes to jets, legendary constructions such as the "Comet" or the "Caravelle", the development of Lufthansa and other companies, and much more. The very informative text is illustrated with excellent selected images of airplanes and airports, aircraft production, passengers and flight personnel, historical advertising, and more. Smoking was allowed! A remarkable aviation history that can be recommended even to small collections. Comprehensive, e.g. R. Niccoli: "Aviation" (ID-B 4/14). Querformat. (1) (Rolf Raschka) The aviation journalist gives a comprehensive insight into the time from the late 1940s to the 1970s, when flying was still a luxury. (Rolf Raschka)

The Beetle: Ferdinand Porsche and the Development of the Volkswagen ¤ Over twenty years of research, including in the very early archives of Volkswagen and Porsche, a variety of previously unpublished photos and development plans, as well as the expertise of one of the most renowned international motor journalists and acknowledged Beetle connoisseurs, converge in "The Beetle" to form a fascinating car biography. Numerous books have thus far illuminated the Beetle's career, yet all only vaguely touch on its development history. Author Chris Barber, on the other hand, focuses exactly on this era of the cult car from Wolfsburg. He goes back seventy years and accompanies the genius car developer Ferdinand Porsche and his team on their mission to build a vehicle that should revolutionize the automotive market. The Volkswagen should be easy to use, it should provide enough space for a five-person family, it should be robust and producible in large series, and: it should be extremely affordable. Ferdinand Porsche succeeded in this feat in a politically diffuse and dangerous environment. Chris Barber's sovereign gaze is owed the fact that the description of the technical masterpiece does not become a blind tribute to the Führer state of Germany. Rather, he manages to place the unique development history of the Beetle without pathos into the prevailing times. Translated into this future standard work on the birth of the Volkswagen by Germany's most competent Beetle experts: Dr. Bernd Wiersch, who had already written his dissertation on the Beetle, led the Wolfsburg "Volkswagen Museum" for many decades.

Applied Statistics : Collection of Methods with R ¤ The freely usable program R is a learnable and flexible tool for data analysis. In the book, the application is illustrated by means of simple, but also more complex examples. Statistical procedures are explained and necessary details for data collection, analysis, and interpretation are conveyed. New in the 14th edition are, among other things, sections on Bayesian estimation and the evaluation of repeated measurements, further recommendations for planning and evaluating scientific studies and a more comprehensive index. (Source: www.buchhandel.de 09.01.2012)

Mathematical Foundations of Natural Sciences ¤ The work conveys to students of natural sciences and technical subjects the simple mathematical foundations from analysis and linear algebra that they need. Review (e.g.): Mathematics provides engineers and natural sciences with very effective tools, which are needed to describe and understand processes and events in nature and technology. The present work now wants to convey to students of natural sciences and technical subjects relevant mathematical foundations.

Demand-oriented Utilization Cycle Management : Conceptual Considerations for Sustainable Land Use Management in City and Region ¤ Die anhaltende Inanspruchnahme unbebauter Flächen für Siedlungszwecke - under other circumstances in consequence of the city-suburbs migration of private households - stands in conflict with the guiding image of sustainable regional development.

Elementary Particle Physics : From Fundamentals to Modern Experiments ; with 51 Tables and 88 Exercises with Solution Hints ¤ Elementary Particle Physics. This textbook offers, from the fundamentals to modern experiments, a systematic introduction up to the latest developments in the field. Experimental tools such as accelerators and detectors are discussed at the beginning. Then follow the symmetry principles and their applications. Subsequently, the Standard Model is developed, which largely dominates the current experimental and theoretical discussion. Essential areas of quantum electrodynamics, the quark model, quantum chromodynamics, and the electroweak theory are explained. Latest experimental results on neutrino physics and the violation of CP symmetry are treated, before the question of possible extensions of the Standard Model is raised. The textbook is attractively designed, 83 exercises with solution hints serve for deepening. TOC: Overview and Tools.- The scattering matrix and its symmetries.- Elementary quantum electrodynamics.- Hadrons in quantum chromodynamics.- Electrons and quarks.- From weak to electroweak interaction.- The Standard Model

Are substances more persistent than the test systems believe? : Evaluation of test systems for persistence assessment by the example of hydrolysis ¤ Hydrolysis is an abiotic process that is crucial for the fate of many water-soluble substances in an aquatic environment. The ability of chemicals to undergo hydrolysis is currently tested in purified lab water in accordance with OECD guideline 111. It has been suggested that the addition of particles such as sediment or microplastic fibers may result in a change in the rate of hydrolysis or in the formation of different transformation products. This study therefore tested the hydrolysis of three environmen-tally relevant compounds with and without addition of microplastic, sediment, or humic acids.
Internet Internals : Layer of Transmission, Structure and Protocols ¤ The author has been active at the University of Applied Sciences Munich for many years. His textbook

Fachwissen Gebäudereinigung ¤ Verlagstext: Grossformatiges, reich illustriertes Grundlehrwerk mit Übungen für Auszubildende und Meisterprüfungsanwärter. Nachschlagewerk für Objektleiter/innen und andere Beschäftigte im Gebäudereiniger-Handwerk sowie die Vergabestellen in Kommunen etc. und Schulungen gem. DIN ISO 9000ff. Verlagstext: Grossformatiges, reich illustriertes Grundlehrwerk mit Übungen für Auszubildende und Meisterprüfungsanwärter. Nachschlagewerk für Objektleiter/innen und andere Beschäftigte im Gebäudereiniger-Handwerk sowie die Vergabestellen in Kommunen etc. und Schulungen gem. DIN ISO 9000ff

Biologists in Industry: What to Expect? ; a Virtual Internship ¤ Beginning from the somewhat precarious situation that Bachelor's degree programs offer little space for real, yet for a later career entry important internships, the authors have developed a concept that replaces them with virtual industry internships with partly real contacts to companies and actual laboratory hours. Additional working materials and assignment tasks are provided by the authors. - At university locations with corresponding training directions. For orientation perhaps already for high school students with relevant study wishes Beginning from the somewhat precarious situation that Bachelor's degree programs offer little space for real, yet for a later career entry important internships, the authors have developed a concept that replaces them with virtual industry internships with partly real contacts to companies and actual laboratory hours. Additional working materials and assignment tasks are provided by the authors. - At university locations with corresponding training directions. For orientation perhaps already for high school students with relevant study wishes.

Space-Oriented Risk Management in Technology and Environment: Catastrophe Prevention through Spatial Planning ¤ The volume contains the results of the working group "Space-Oriented Risk Management in Technology and Environment". With this, it has been possible for the first time to present the overlapping areas of catastrophe prevention and spatially oriented planning in important outlines. Because the spatial sciences have hardly paid attention to the large, catastrophe-prone risks in the environment and technology in the past. At the same time, the spatial dimension has often been neglected in the various scientific approaches to this topic. With a view to the state of scientific research, the regional or spatial implications of large risks in the environment and technology are therefore systematically brought to the forefront here. The effects on the human capital of a society are considered just as much as those on natural, real, and social capital. Often, it is an unadapted use of locations and institutional deficits in social systems that are responsible for outstanding risks. The working group has assumed that from the integrative perspective of spatial planning, the anthropogenic dimension of large environmental and technology risks is at the center of interest. Space-oriented prevention against environmental and technology risks a) Spatial risks and risk prevention b) Risk-oriented spatial planning policy: approaches and foreign experiences Case studies.

Nietzsche : Biography of his Thinking ¤ Like few others, Friedrich Nietzsche has shaped modern thought. He called himself dynamite. One can imagine his thinking as a laboratory where provocative, sometimes risky arguments are experimented with. His philosophy does not result in a system, but rather lives from its inner dynamics. Rüdiger Safranski called his significant and highly successful Nietzsche book, which appeared on the 100th anniversary of his death and was translated into many languages, a 'biography of his thinking'. On the 175th birthday on October 15, 2019, a new edition of this standard work appears, expanded with an afterword that highlights the unbroken topicality of Nietzsche's thinking.

What is good work? Requirements for career entry from the perspective of the young generation: Results of a representative survey of career entrants between 18 and 34 years old with completed vocational training ¤ In the center of the representative survey "Requirements for career entry from the perspective of the young generation" are young people between 18 and 34 years old who can at least demonstrate completed vocational training. According to the Mikrozensus (2005), this group of trained young working people comprises approximately 9.77 million people. The investigation retrospectively illuminates the transition at the second threshold, i.e. the transition after completing an apprenticeship or a degree into working life. (Source: Introduction).

Laterales Management : the success principle for companies in the digital age ¤ Lead, decide, work together: Why lateral management is the answer to the digitalization of the economy Digitalization will change the economy and society in the coming years as dramatically as electrification did a hundred years ago. While leadership and collaboration in the 20th century were still hierarchically organized, the digital future will be shaped by lateral management - by leading on an equal footing. Roland Geschwill and Martina Nieswandt analyze what this will mean for us and our working world in the future, but also show what opportunities the digitalization process offers for companies, people, and managers: The chance for more freedom, more individuality, more exciting jobs, more creativity, and more innovation. (Publisher's text)

Holz erkennen und benutzen : das Nachschlagewerk für die Praxis ; [over 200 wood species and their use] ¤ The title is about 30 pages more comprehensive and includes 17 new wood species compared to the previous edition "Holz bestimmen und benutzen". Nevertheless, the edition from 2006 can certainly remain in stock. After a brief introduction to the material wood with drying, cutting, grain and wood defects, 219 wood species, each presented on an A4 page, are listed alphabetically by botanical name. The always similarly structured pages contain a photo of the grain, the text includes the sections Description, Properties, Drying and Stability, Durability (including pests), Use, Origin and Health Risks. Partly supplemented by photos of workpieces. More processing-oriented and comprehensive than the otherwise comparable "Atlas of Wood Species" (ID 17/10). As a more affordable and sufficient material expert for DIYers, "Material Wood" (BA 2/03) is still recommended. (3) (Karin Lehmann) 219 wood species are presented with the important properties for wood craftsmen: grain with photo, processing properties, aging behavior, growth forms, weights, typical uses, all common name variants and possible health risks. (Karin Lehmann)

Fachkunde Gefahrstoffe : Knowledge, Fundamentals and Tips for the Creation of a Hazard Assessment in accordance with TRGS 400 ¤ Whoever creates a hazard assessment for activities involving hazardous substances must, in accordance with the 6 Hazardous Substances Ordinance, be able to demonstrate expertise. Required are sufficient knowledge of - the hazardous properties of the hazardous substances used,- the work processes and the tasks to be performed, - the relevant regulations to assess the working conditions and to evaluate the established protective measures during an activity. This book shows which knowledge - regardless of branch, activity and company - is required to be able to carry out a hazard assessment for activities involving hazardous substances expertly.

Abklingphase of the Höglwald Project - Late Consequences of Acid Rain and Limestone Application: Final Report of the Research Project ¤ Im Höglwald zwischen München und Augsburg werden seit 1984 die Auswirkungen von saurer Beregnung und Kalkung auf einen gut wüchsigen Fichtenaltbestand interdisziplinär untersucht. Hauptziel des Höglwaldprojekt ist es, unter realistischen Freilandbedingungen interdisziplinär und ökologisch umfassend zu überprüfen, inwieweit Fichtenwälder durch Säureeintrag geschädigt werden und ob eventuelle Schäden mttels kompensatorischer Kalkung verhindert werden können ...

The Big Bang and Other Catastrophes ¤ Dramatis personae: God creating the world, several chaotic assistants including Schrödinger's cat and Laplace's demon, who always turns green when talking about quantum and probabilities. Furthermore: boxes and crates with elementary particles; explosions, smoke, and a lot of noise. In this way, the reader experiences the origin of the universe, learns something about the structure of matter, elementary particles, and forces, the periodic system, quantum mechanics, and relativity theory, electrical conductivity, insulators, semiconductors, crystals, nuclear fusion, etc. At the end: the quantum mechanical Santa Claus as an overlap of wave functions, which can deliver gifts everywhere at the same time. The book is based on physical short stories for "Physics in our Time". A cabaret-like ride through the basics of natural sciences and some technical aspects, which conveys a lot of solid knowledge despite the sometimes quite crazy presentation. Thinking is required, as it's about quite complex matters. Definitely worth getting. (1)

Viking Ships ¤ The author, who has been publishing in the GDR (after studying shipbuilding machinery until 1990, he was accordingly active; here lastly "Norman Ships", BA 9/87), describes after an introduction to the history of the Northmen and their shipbuilding craft the current state of knowledge about the recovery of long and transport ships in Norway, Denmark, and Schleswig-Holstein (e.g. the Oseberg ship as well as the vehicles presented in exemplary fashion in Roskilde, Denmark), their archaeological investigation and the insights gained into their construction and operation (each ship is introduced with a data sheet). The information in the factual, also well-readable text for non-specialists is well illustrated by precisely placed, partly double-page color images (also of replicas), drawings, and graphics. With glossary and bibliography (numerous references to English publications as well as those in Scandinavian languages), but without subject index. - As the only currently available, attractively designed, and suitable for broad circles of interest title on the subject: (2) (Wei) Presentation of the excavations of ships from the Viking Age in Norway, Denmark, and Schleswig-Holstein (e.g. Oseberg and Haithabu ships), their archaeological investigation, and the insights gained into shipbuilding and operation at that time. (Wei)

Regenerative Energiesystems : Technology - Calculation - Simulation : with 271 colored images, 113 tables and a DVD ¤ Textbook for students and engineers at universities and universities of applied sciences as well as in research and teaching on the entire spectrum of renewable energies. Deals with the problem of energy supply and gives hints on future development trends. A DVD-ROM with a collection of demo programs and full versions for simulating regenerative energy systems is attached; in addition, illustrations as copy templates and additional photos. Compared to the 2nd edition 1999 (ID 9/00), it was expanded by about 120 pages and improved in equipment (now contains consistently colored images). An exchange of editions is sensible. (3)

Glass Construction ¤ Introductory series of basics for architecture and civil engineering students, which externally resembles study scripts (cf. in this issue D. Haas-Arndt, B. Bielefeld, most recently T. Bürklin BA 1/09). The present title offers easily understandable first information on the building material glass and its applications. The technical properties of different functional and design glasses (e.g. thermal insulation, sound insulation, insulating glass, colored glass) are treated, as well as the constructive possibilities, applications, and limits of the material. Typically equipped with small-format black-and-white photos, construction drawings, tables, references to standards, literature references. Little literature on the subject is available, most recently

Statistics and Intuition : Everyday Examples Critically Examined ¤ Verl.Beschr.: This non-fiction book shows how statistical thinking can be successful and lead to greater competence in dealing with uncertainty. Deeply ingrained thought habits make us intuitively search for truths and patterns in everyday life, not for probabilities, as statistics provides. The book clarifies how the thought patterns of statisticians and non-statisticians differ, what misunderstandings arise from this, and what statistics has to do with truth. It thus promotes active and responsible handling of statistics through practical examples from everyday life and shows how to correctly interpret and communicate statistical statements. A current focus lies on Big Data and the associated data journalism

Satellites : since 1957 ¤ The US National Space Science Data Center currently counts approximately 7,000 spacecraft launched since 1957. Here, 40 representative civil and military Earth satellites are presented. With photos, illustrations, and tables. (Rolf Becker-Friedrich) The US National Space Science Data Center currently counts approximately 7,000 spacecraft launched since 1957; including space probes that have left Earth's orbit (Eugen Reichl: ID-A 3/12) and those that have simply crashed (or were forced to crash due to being defective or outdated). Excluding manned vehicles and ISS supply ships, here, 40 Earth satellites are presented, military and civilian (news, weather, GPS, telescopes, communication, observation, surveillance, research, etc.) from all nations, from the 1-kg midget to the 7-tonne heavy-duty communication satellites. Sputnik, Telstar, Intelsat, Meteosat, Envisat are likely to be well-known to many, others may be less well-known to the general public, but are also of great importance. Numerous photos, illustrations with many details, tables; reasonably priced, informative, compact; broad recommendation, not only as an addition to the aforementioned title. (2) (Rolf Becker-Friedrich)

Unlimited Preemption of Criminal Law? ¤ Already, the legislator has considered it too risky to punish only the violation of rights under the law. And so, he penalizes behaviors that are likely to be dangerous, or which - further pre-empted - only carry the germ cell of future evil within themselves. The inevitable end of such pre-emption would be the punishment of evil thoughts - no mere thought experiment, as recent creations of criminal offenses show. This is one perspective on the unlimited pre-emption of criminal law mentioned in the title of this volume. The other is linked to the clearly defined threat scenarios of international terrorism or so-called organized crime, which seem to demand two things: a uniform and at the same time networked transnational approach. Here too, the inevitable consequence is an extension of the criminal law ... (Source: Book cover text / Publisher)

Flut and Ground : A Family Novel ¤ Out of a student depression and search for meaning, the sensitive author embarks on a search for his family's past. Regularly, they would set out from the south of the republic to the Weser to Vegesack in the high-ranking house of their grandparents. There, grandfather Friedrich grew up with his siblings. He joined the Nazis and became department head of the

Liquid ring vacuum pumps, compressors and systems : conventional and hermetic design ¤ Modern industrial process engineering is today unthinkable without vacuum technology. This handbook arose from the practice of active engineers and gives an overview of the entire vacuum field.

El Niño : Climate Makes History ¤ Many think that El Niño is only a problem for Pacific coastal countries and would not affect us in Europe. Starting from El Niño phenomena on the South American Pacific coast, the American geographer Caviedes, who has been researching El Niño for over 30 years, shows that other continents and Central Europe have been feeling the consequences of El-Niño and La-Niña events for a long time. The content includes, among other things, the origin of El Niño and La Niña, remote and feedback interactions in the global weather machine, meteorological, ecological, economic, cultural, social, and political consequences. By evaluating archaeological and historical sources, he follows the traces of El Niño in world history. A demanding scientific book with a lot of theory, but also with many exciting examples, colorful diagrams, and overview maps. No glossary, but a detailed register, further literature, also in German. This fascinating non-fiction book presents many connections and opens up new perspectives and insights for interested laypeople. Highly recommended. (2) Fascinating non-fiction book about the origin and consequences of El-Niño and La-Niña events, remote and feedback interactions of large-scale weather systems, climate history of climate zones and continents, the influence of climate crises on civilizations and events in world history. (Ingrid Rall-Haiß)

Ubuntu 18.04 : Practical Knowledge for New and Experienced Users ¤ The Linux operating system exists in various distributions and derivatives. A very popular derivative is Ubuntu, closely connected to the Debian distribution. M. Fischer is the author of a comprehensive handbook on this topic. Troche has written a very concise introduction, which is limited to essential basic knowledge. He has now updated his last title for the Ubuntu version 16.04. The LTS version 18.04 is dealt with, which again receives five years of support with updates. With this new version, the groundbreaking developments of the past few years are abandoned (Desktop system Unity and display manager Mir) and the Gnome/X-Window-Server pair returns for display and management of the work surface. Troche has incorporated corresponding changes. In addition, he has almost all chapters revised and partially expanded. A chapter that contained brief descriptions of Ubuntu programs has been omitted. There is again a DVD supplement for quick installation. Predecessors are still usable (updates until 2021)

The Global Surveillance : The Snowden Case, the American Intelligence Agencies and the Consequences ¤ In June 2013, Glenn Greenwald published the first NSA documents from the archive of whistleblower Edward Snowden. Since then, increasingly alarming details of the global surveillance system of the American intelligence agencies have been uncovered. Now, Greenwald presents the full extent of mass surveillance in light of a wealth of exclusive, never-before-published secret documents. Everything and everyone is being spied on, the population is under collective suspicion. Freedom of opinion is suppressed in the name of security, and there is no longer any privacy - anywhere. In May 2013, Edward Snowden met in Hong Kong with documentary filmmaker Laura Poitras and lawyer and journalist Glenn Greenwald, thus setting the NSA affair in motion. Glenn Greenwald has now written a book about the 'Snowden case', in which he reports extensively on the background. Chronologically, from Snowden's first, covert contact attempts, which almost failed due to Greenwald's lack of interest, to Snowden's flight to Moscow, he recounts the events once again and illustrates the enormous dimension that the surveillance drive and the collecting frenzy of the American security agency NSA have taken on. Based on the documents obtained by Snowden, Greenwald analyzes the NSA's actions and warns impressively of the possible consequences for society. In doing so, he writes so engagingly and incisively that the book reads like a novel - a first-class spy thriller at times. High media echo. (M. Voß)

Competition for Resources : Conflicts over Climate, Water, and Land ¤ Climate, water, and land are equally indispensable and endangered resources of humanity. What happens when a competition for their use breaks out? What conflicts can arise from this? Internationally renowned experts address the question of how resource conflicts and resource scarcity affect both domestic and global levels, and examine exemplary forms of cooperation and conflict resolution. Their contributions reflect the findings and perspectives of different disciplines: The book covers political science, economics, economic and social geography, international law, regional science, as well as theological-normative aspects - and thus opens up a highly topical field of peace and conflict research.

Operation and Upgrade of the Neutron Four-Circle Diffractometer TEX-2 at FRG-1 (GKSS Research Centre) : Final Report, Completion Date of the Project: 31.3.1995 ¤ Polymorph measurement, Texture analysis, Neutron diffraction, Composite materials, Metals, Alloys, Ores, intermetallic compounds, Rocks

Key Figures for the Electrician: Selected Tables, Images, and Diagrams from the VDE Regulations Manual as well as Relevant EN and DIN Standards ¤ Publisher's text: The book serves as a reference work with interpretations for existing important legal regulations, standardized properties and terms, selected key figures and specifications. These are to be taken into account when preparing, manufacturing, and testing electrical installations and their most important operating equipment and devices. Also included are interpretations and original documents of DIN and DIN-VDE standards.

C and Linux: Utilizing the Capabilities of the Operating System with Own Programs ¤ Practice aids for Linux system programming are relatively sparse. A standard work already appears in its 4th edition (the 2nd edition, ID 44/02, shown here last, must be replaced; only partially useful: 3rd edition 2005 not shown here), which mediates the obvious programming in C, as almost the entire operating system itself is written in ANSI-C. The source texts of the new edition have been adapted to the newly developed Linux Standard Base, and the topic of controlling devices via USB is also new. Examples of network programming have been expanded and new development environments are described. Offers advanced programmers with C basic knowledge further guidance under the use of the numerous Linux tools available and with the help of many detailed examples easily understandable instructions, inter alia, for creating hardware practice solutions, graphical user interfaces or own help pages. A meaningful addition to the LINUX literature, the previous edition is practically permanently borrowed in Munich. Currently, there are no current comparison titles! (2)

E-World : Technologies for the World of Tomorrow ¤ The development of new information technologies is advancing very quickly. The working world and society will change like never before. The author introduces the most important IT trends of the coming years. He does not remain on the surface, but tries to explain the backgrounds and thus to awaken a better understanding of the consequences that can arise from these developments. Problematic effects are clearly named. The author's core statement is that control over the future E-World is indispensable. Only in this way can it be guaranteed that this E-World remains a human world. Interesting, lively, and easily understandable presentation. Extensive historical references. Partly, the leading employee Frank K., a typical product of the modern, post-capitalist, global economic order, is accompanied in his work and considerations. Helpful general understandable glossary in the scope of 13 pages. Good compilation of further information (also magazine articles and addresses in the World Wide Web). (2)

I Pluck an Eyelash and Stab You with It ¤ Reisen, um heimatlos zu werden. Henri Michaux writes: "Reisen, um heimatlos zu werden". The Austrian Josef Winkler has repeatedly traveled to Italy during the writing of his novels about his homeland, Carinthia, later to India and then to Mexico, carrying with him the stories of other authors, from which he uses short quotes as inlays in his poetological reportages: from journeys that bring him back to his own surprise with variations of a picture from childhood - a child lying by the roadside, already wrapped in packing paper, run over. Last in Klagenfurt, where during roadworks in preparation for the 2008 European Football Championship a child is run over and dies. Story by story, death by death, Winkler draws closer to his state of being homeless. Erzählung für Erzählung, Todesfall für Todesfall rückt Winkler seiner Heimatlosigkeit näher. END

Mathematics to Take Along : Summaries and Overviews from Arens et al., Mathematics ¤ In addition to "Arbeitsbuch Mathematik" (BA 1/09) and "Ergänzungen und Vertiefungen zu Arens et al., Mathematik" (BA 2/09), a handy summary in pocket book format is now added as an additional "satellite" to the textbook "Mathematik" (BA 12/08). This compilation is intended as a companion to seminars, group work etc. , where the textbook is unsuitable due to its form. (2 pages)

Exercises in Mathematics for Engineers: With Calculated and Explained Solutions ¤ Publisher's text: In this exercise book, about 160 problems in engineering mathematics are worked out and explained in detail. Unlike many other mathematics exercise books, the author shows his readers how to solve such problems from the first approach to the result. The main part of the exercises refers to the problems given in the mathematics textbook for engineers by the same author

AutoCAD 2002 for Dummies : [Design and Drawing with Links! ; So get their designs hand and foot ; Bring out their creativity on the Internet big ; Editing, Measuring, Plotting & Co.] ¤ Introduction to the functions of AutoCAD: Commands, Tools, Assistant, Zoom, Drawing Data Management, 3D etc.; with illustrations. (LK/N: Pleuß) Easy-to-understand introduction to the current AutoCAD version with numerous examples, exercises and tips for problem-solving. Follow-up book for the AutoCAD 2000 version (cf. Middlebrook: BA 4/00). First provides a general overview with a list of differences to the 2000 version as well as general guidelines for drawing creation. Then follow practical instructions on important elements and commands, on strategies for error avoidance etc. In the appendix, installation instructions, tables, a glossary. Can be used even before the official company course (cf. "AutoCAD 2002" in this issue). The old edition can be consumed, but should be supplemented by the new edition. (2) (LK/N: Pleuß)

Mathematical Modeling with MATLAB® : a practical introduction ¤ Dass vorausschauende Prognosen durch mathematische Modelle gestützt werden, erfolgt in sehr unterschiedlichen Bereichen, sei es in der Wirtschaft, bei Wettervorhersagen, in der Kosmologie oder auch nur, um die optimale Flugbahn eines Balles zu bestimmen. Dazu muss eine mathematische Struktur gefunden werden, in der die Ausgangsgrößen und die bestimmenden Naturgesetze interpretiert werden können. Die Resultate mathematischer Prozesse müssen dann wieder in die Realität übersetzt werden. The text introduces the problem with a detailed case study and then deals with the topic generally and fundamentally. The numerical calculations use the routines and possibilities of the MATLAB program system, which is explained again in the appendix. The book is aimed at students in the bachelor's program, who, however, must have some mathematical knowledge, as deeper lying proofs are mostly only hinted at. (3)

Biomass in the Tension Field between Energy and Climate Policy: Strategies for Sustainable Bioenergy Use: Position Paper ¤ Bioenergy is the most versatile energy carrier among the Renewables and supplies more energy than wind and water power, solar energy, and geothermal energy combined. A consistent bioenergy policy must ensure that bioenergy use has no negative social and ecological consequences and makes the maximum contribution to climate protection.

Economic Promotion through the Promotion of Renewable Energies? : An Empirical Comparison of the Renewable Energy Act with Conventional Economic Promotion ¤ The use of renewable energy sources for power generation has increased dramatically in recent years. As a rule, however, such use is still not economical and is therefore cross-subsidised. In Germany this support is provided largely on the basis of the Renewable Energy Act. The focus of the present analysis is the extent to which the Act can also be regarded as a successful instrument of business promotion. To find an answer to this question, an investigation was carried out into the amount of additional private investment generated by public subsidies for the wind and photovoltaic power generation subsidised by the Act, on the one hand, and conventional regional business and research promotion, on the other. The results show that the wind farm sector scored rather better than the traditional instruments of business promotion, whereas the photovoltaic power industry performed much worse. When interpreting the results, however, account must be taken of some of the special features of the subsidies provided by the Act, such as a guaranteed market for 20 years at fixed prices. END

Stairs, Staircases ¤ The accessibility of buildings represents a crucial aspect in the design and detailed planning. In addition to constructive aspects and building physical requirements, the formal, safety-relevant boundary conditions are to be noted in particular. In this context, the aspects of barrier-free building acquire special importance. The construction forms are presented in detailed sections - depending on the building material. The present volume is rounded off by a representation of the planning criteria for the installation of elevators and escalators.

Artificial Intelligence in Plain Language ¤ The author provides a didactically well-structured and concise introduction to the field of 'Artificial Intelligence' (AI), which is well-suited for refreshing basic knowledge - for example, in preparation for an exam. The book is roughly comparable to J. Hövel (BA 5/03), a journalistic treatment of the subject. Readers seeking a comprehensive representation with a formal/scientific approach should be referred to G. Görz (ID 46/00). The author relies on many examples and algorithms that can be implemented in different languages. Prior knowledge in Prolog, however, significantly facilitates working with the book. The author presents typical AI problems and AI technologies and also provides a glimpse of what can be achieved with AI in the future.
