Chemical Delights ¤ No sign of boredom, plenty of reading fun instead, and learn something about chemistry on the side? Klaus Roth achieves this like no one else. He doesn't just explain; no, he makes chemistry come alive with all its witty, serious, and fascinating sides! Let yourself be taken on a richly illustrated, wild ride through chemistry. But take a sip of fresh water first: The journey will be long, but never boring. But wait! Please use only energized, vitalized, clustered, stretched, enlivened, and right-handed water - or is that all just hocus pocus?

From Classical Physics to Quantum Physics: A Historically-Critical Deductive Derivation with Applications from Solid-State Physics ¤ This book takes a new approach from Classical to Quantum Physics. After describing Euler's and Helmholtz's representations of Classical Mechanics, the Schrödinger equation is derived without making any additional assumptions about the nature of quantum mechanical systems. Emphasis is placed on the similarities between Classical and Quantum Mechanics, and four fundamental problems of quantization named by Schrödinger are solved. The historical literature is referred to in detail. This book is not only addressed to students and scientists, but also to school teachers: It contains many details that are no longer included in modern representations of Classical Mechanics, but are important for understanding Quantum Physics. TOC:Why Quantum Theory?.- On the relationships between Classical Mechanics and Quantum Mechanics.- Basic concepts of Classical Mechanics.- From Classical Mechanics to Quantum Mechanics.- From single-particle to many-particle systems.- Occupation number representation for bosons.- Occupation number representation for fermions.- From many-particle systems to quantum field theory.- Outlook

Methods of Calculation for Physics Students in the First Year ¤ Methods of calculation that the physics student needs in the first semesters. Markus Otto, born in 1982, knows what the student needs. Briefly, but precisely, he explains the methods of calculation with examples. Brief notes are underlined in gray. At the end of each chapter, there is a crib sheet that summarizes everything like a collection of formulas. This book is highly suitable for physics beginners. H. Fischer: "Mathematics for Physicists" (in this issue) is more detailed, but the notes and crib sheets are missing. (3)
Small Baths : the best solutions up to 10 sqm ¤ Professionally planned baths as wellness oases and retreats from the daily hectic were already presented in the attractive picture-text book

Right-Wing Extremism: Prevention and Intervention: An Overview of Approaches, Findings, and Development Needs ¤ The book provides an overview of central aspects of prevention of and intervention against right-wing extremism as well as in-depth information and suggestions for reflection and professional further development of existing practice approaches.

The Break : France's Divided Society ¤ In Statements and Interviews from 2015 and 2016, the renowned expert on French Islamism comments on the development of our neighbor, as it has been unfolding since the attacks under the conditions of a state of siege as well as societal and political polarization. (2-3)

The High Line : the green vein of New York ¤ In this photo book, planning, development, maintenance of the facility, as well as the background of the project "High Line" are presented. On the over 3 km long area of a former freight rail track in New York, the famous landmark has been created, which was opened as a park in 2014. After the introduction of a co-founder of the project, in an essay the basics and prerequisites of modern landscape design in the urban space are discussed, which made the creation of the modern facility possible. In the main part, the individual garden areas are presented from south to north using a map, which are characterized by different design and planting. In addition, chapters on the maintenance of the facility and seasonal aspects are included. The atmospheric color photos are inspiring and convey a diverse impression of the lively green space through Manhattan

Pocket Book of Mathematical Formulas for Engineers and Natural Scientists ¤ The comprehensive pocket book on mathematics is a compact and competent reference work for students of technical disciplines at universities and colleges and for practitioners to refresh their knowledge. In the 24th edition, the chapters on differential calculus and differential equations are revised

Theoretical Physics : with 6 Tables ¤ 1. Overview of theoretical physics. The textbook is intended for students with physics as a minor subject, for the teaching profession at grammar schools, Bachelor's degree, and as a 1st introduction to Master's or Diploma courses in physics. The areas of mechanics, electromagnetism, quantum mechanics, and thermodynamics are initially treated in introductory, then in subsequent chapters. The author has worked for over 30 years as a professor of theoretical physics. More widely applicable than the multi-volume editions of theoretical physics, most recently E. Rebhah (ID 31/00 and 6/05). L. Landau (ID 6/05) and T. Fließbach (in this number). Contains no exercise problems. Recommended as a supplement to other physics textbooks and exercise books. (3)

Development of a uniform safety technical concept for the construction and operation of ground effect vehicles (GEV), TEBEF Phase 3 ¤ Ground effect vehicles, GEV, load assumptions for GEV, stability of GEV, safety analysis, functional hazard analysis, tests, ISM Code, operating limits

Digitalization in Care: Supporting Better Work Organization ¤ This book systematically focuses on the approaches of digitalization that improve work organization in care and thus have the potential to contribute to higher job satisfaction of care workers. Digitalization in care is currently being very controversially discussed. "Will care workers in the future be replaced by care robots?" Such and similar headlines raise far-reaching ethical questions and do not contribute to making the potential that digitalization offers for the care industry visible. This book deals with approaches to digitalization that support care workers in their daily work or also increase the quality of life of care recipients. The presented approaches were scientifically founded and have proven themselves in practice. The book also shows how the process of digital transformation in care can be successfully implemented - namely in a way that the employees in care are designers of their own change process from the beginning. The editors Dr. Vanessa Kubek is a Diplom-Politologin, graduated in economics at the TU Kaiserslautern and is a systemic consultant (DGSF), systemic coach and organizational developer (SG/DGSF). Dr. Sebastian Velten studied economics and mathematics at the TU Kaiserslautern and graduated in economics at the University of Saarland in Saarbrücken. Since 2008, he has been working as a research assistant at the Fraunhofer Institute for Techno- and Economics Mathematics ITWM. Dr. Frank Eierdanz is a Diplom-Geograph, graduated in psychology at the University of Kassel and has been working as a research assistant at the Institute for Technology and Work in Kaiserslautern since 2009. Annette Blaudszun-Lahm is a Diplom-Pflegewirtin and nurse. Since 2002, she has been working as a research assistant at the Institute for Technology and Work e.V. Chapter 8 „Sustainable motivation through well-being-oriented design“ is published on link.springer.com under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License. The background of this editor's book: Innovative projects -- Specific challenges of digital transformation in care -- Digitalization in care: Overview of current approaches -- Participatory and needs-oriented strategies for digitalization in care facilities -- Strengthening self-organization in the team through a digital scheduling platform -- Speech recognition - a basic building block of digitalization strategies in care -- Participatory digitalization of care work: The example of the „digital tour guide“ -- Sustainable motivation through well-being-oriented design -- Employee satisfaction in the context of digital transformation processes -- Acceptance of digitalization at the interface between care and medicine -- Digital assistance in scheduling -- Process of care documentation and effects of digitalization -- Voices from practice: How do care facilities experience the process of digital transformation? -- Chances and risks of digital transformation projects in terms of job satisfaction in care.

Visual Web Developer 2005 Express Edition for Dummies : [the ideal starter package for dynamic web programming ; present the website uniformly through style sheets and master pages ; through database binding, obtain dynamic web pages , express edition on accompanying CD-ROM] ¤ The program is a tool with which dynamic, database-supported websites can be developed, however not suitable for computer beginners. The author, a database expert, accompanies the reader from the 1st idea to implementation and deals with challenging things like binding to the SQL Server, working with style sheets, using user accounts and ASP.NET controls. Express Edition on accompanying CD-ROM. (3)

Internet for Dummies : [the quick entry into the network ; safe surfing on the web ; chatting, blogging and emailing] ¤ Comprehensive internet introduction for beginners. Covers general basics, internet security, hardware and software requirements, search strategies, music and video, web shopping, online banking, email and chat. (LK/HB: Isigkeit) Levine's internet introduction is a bestseller. Now in its 11th edition, the topic is again presented in a fluent language in the widely introduced Dummies series. A comparison with the last reviewed edition (BA 9/06) shows that the updates and additions affect the entire text. Security aspects are illuminated from different angles, the configuration of a cable modem is considered (power line-based home networks are missing, however) and Windows Mail now appears in the email programs. The chapter on the own web presence has been clearly expanded. Here, the free available editor Nvu is also discussed in more detail. Also new is the final chapter on playing in the web. World of Warcraft and Second Life are presented exemplarily. As with the previous editions, well usable. The 6th edition should be discontinued, while older editions should be sorted out. (1)

Roof Stages ¤ Publisher's text: The roof is the primal form of human dwellings, where wood as a building material for roof constructions still holds an enormous significance in residential construction. Due to its low weight, fast assembly, elementarity, and modern connection technology, wooden roof stages will also be used in the future. The book provides an overview of the common construction systems used in old and new buildings, up to special forms, roof dormers, and modern constructions. Similarly, constructive approaches are shown and explained, as well as hints given to analyze the inventory and set constructive measures to enable later roof space use. Furthermore, the principles of roof stiffening are explained and construction proposals are given.

Der Brockhaus Astronomie : Planets, Stars, Galaxies ¤ The new standard work for amateur astronomers. 3,300 entries contain all important information on astronomy, famous astronomers, and spaceflight achievements. 500 illustrations, including specially prepared graphics of the most important star charts, in which the individual star brightness is also indicated. There are numerous general introductions to astronomy at all levels, with the market being significantly narrower for lexicons. So, the Brockhaus Astronomy closes the broad gap between the very popular "Dictionary of Astronomy" (H.-U. Keller: BA 5/05) as the first reference work and the 6,000 term explaining "ABC Lexicon of Astronomy" (BA 1/97) for a scientifically pre-trained audience (Spectrum; BA 1/97). Approximately 3,300 entries, accompanied by 12 special articles, many information boxes, tables, and instructive color graphics, offers the present reference work, which, compared to the Brockhaus Encyclopedia (20th edition: from BA 5/97) and the 3-volume "Brockhaus Natural Sciences and Technology" (BA 1/03), contains significantly more extensive biographical and subject articles. These are clearly organized and partially already very helpful for student presentations. - Library-worthy title, to be acquired for smaller collections if possible. (1 A, S) (Olaf Kaptein)

Excel 2010 for Dummies : [at a glance: create and safely edit worksheets ; sort, analyze, and present data ; enhance tables and conjure up diagrams ; make life easier with formulas] ¤ Review: In the introduced series, the author, known for numerous publications on the spreadsheet calculation Excel, presents the necessary basic knowledge for the new version Excel 2010 (further programs of the Office package within this series see in this issue). Both the structure and the majority of the text are based on the predecessor to Excel 2007 (BA 9/07). At a few places where innovations come into play (e.g. Sparklines, screenshot integration, Web App) or the terminology has changed (e.g. menu bar instead of multifunctional toolbar), the text has been revised and updated. The numerous illustrations have also been replaced to a large extent. If there are deviations due to different operating systems (XP, Vista, Windows 7), this is explicitly addressed. Beginners also receive a competent guide to the widely used program with this introduction from the popular series. For many libraries for updating the holdings after Rainer Schwabe (BA 10/10). (2) (LK/HB: Isigkeit) Introduction to the current version of the spreadsheet calculation, which equips Excel newcomers with the necessary basic knowledge. (LK/HB: Isigkeit)

Advanced Multivariate Analysis Methods: An Application-Oriented Introduction ¤ While the foundational work "Multivariate Analysis Methods" by the same author is primarily aimed at the bachelor's level, the book "Advanced Multivariate Analysis Methods" is targeted at the use in master's and PhD programs. Furthermore, the readers are offered a presentation of the complex procedures of multivariate analysis on the internet platform www.multivariate.de.
Encyclopedia of German Narrow-Gauge Railways : [History, Tracks, Vehicles] ¤ Books about narrow-gauge railways are occasionally found in the review service (most recently:

Individual Environmental Action and Climate Protection (IndUK) – Final and Completion Report: Result Integration and Transdisciplinary Utilization of Findings from SÖF Research on the Social Dimensions of Climate Protection and Climate Change: Project Period: 01.04.2014-31.12.2014 ¤ „It is foreseeable that strategies for dealing with climate change cannot be derived from scientific research results alone. How people perceive this, what consequences it has for them, and whether and how they are willing to implement corresponding strategies depends strongly on the respective social and cultural environment“ (BMBF 2015; http://www.fona.de/de/9874). Against this background, numerous research projects were funded within the framework of social-ecological research in the focus area of social dimensions of climate protection and climate change from 2010 to 2014, with a focus on individual environmental action. Following the funding phase, the IndUK project exemplarily tested with several research consortia the synthesis and utilization of results. „Utilization projects“ are an important instrument of transdisciplinary research to increase the societal impact of research results and to provide stronger feedback between research results and strategies (Defila et al. 2011). Through a subsequent transfer phase, the societal valuation of research results can be improved by supporting the acquisition of knowledge generated up to the project's completion by decision-makers, stakeholders, or users. IndUK aimed at the transdisciplinary integration and knowledge transfer of research results from the consortia projects: REBOUND – The social dimension of the rebound effect (e.g. ZEW); KlimaAlltag – Climate change and everyday action (e.g. ISOE); EMIGMA – Empowerment of migrants for climate protection (e.g. FH Dortmund); SPREAD – Scenarios of perception and reaction to adaptation (e.g. CESR).Purpose and objectives of the investigationThe subject of the project was the integration and transdisciplinary utilization of findings from the four SÖF research projects on the social dimensions of climate protection and climate change. The process of knowledge integration was structured by three sub-goals: 1. Integration of results on individual environmental action for climate protection from the four participating projects in a matrix. 2. Further discussion and processing of the matrix regarding the interdisciplinarity of the connection and transferability of results. 3. Transdisciplinary integration and utilization of action knowledge in two thematic fields. The objective of the IndUK project was accordingly to bundle the results in two essential points: statements on the form of possibly future more frequent follow-up project processing in the German research landscape and the development of a matrix that converts project results into understandable action options.

The Betrayed Generation : What We Demand of Women in Midlife ¤ The women of birth years 1955 to 1970 - the Baby Boomers - started as the first generation of women in Germany with a good education and a lot of enthusiasm in a life that promised them equal opportunities and rights like men. Today, good thirty years later, the balance is far from positive for all. The careers of many of these women ended abruptly when they had children. Subsequently, they had a significantly more difficult access to the labor market - and after a divorce, they bore the financial responsibility for themselves and the half-grown children. Today, hundreds of thousands of these women are facing old-age poverty. Christina Bylow and Kristina Vaillant write about the discrimination of Baby Boomer women in a society that is obsessed with sexiness, about pension injustice, the alienation between men and women - and about what this women's generation has achieved nonetheless.

Energy Compendium : a reference work for basic concepts, concepts and technologies : with 323 illustrations and 107 tables ¤ The reference work comprises over 2,200 articles, including the subject areas of renewable energies, power plants, energy efficiency, energy storage, gas and power grids, energy economics, as well as energy and climate policy.

Textile finishing by innovative joining processes for the industrial production of textile-reinforced concrete elements : KoTexBet ; within the BMBF research program "Building and Living" on the topic of joint projects for the development and testing of new building methods and techniques : Final report of the joint project ¤ Contains final reports of the Institute for Textile Technology of RWTH Aachen, the Institute for Massive Construction of RWTH Aachen (= Institute Report No. 159/2006) and the Institute for Joining and Welding Technology of TU Braunschweig

Complexities: Why We Only Begin to Understand the World ¤ A new challenge for science: The world is complex, so should our conceptions of it be. Many disciplines of the humanities and social sciences have long adhered to this maxim. The natural sciences, however, have traditionally sought simple, universal, and timeless laws. With this, they wanted to explain the

Coursebook Climate Adaptation: Action Options for the Hamburg Metropolitan Region ¤ The coursebook is directed at employees on all levels of administration in offices, authorities, and branch-specific chambers and associations as well as non-governmental organizations, such as environmental associations or initiatives.

Perl : Fundamentals, Advanced Techniques, Exercises ; [Operators, Functions, Regular Expressions, Hashes, References ; User Interfaces, Persistence, CGI Programming, AJAX ; Exercises with Pattern Solutions for each Chapter] ¤ Perl is a free, platform-independent programming language. Perl is used today not only in system and network administration, but often also in the development of web applications. The author is known for a comprehensive introduction to Perl 5.6 (BA 11/02). In the present book, he devotes himself to the current version 5.8.8, but often also uses Perl 6-compatible modules (the next version Perl 6 is already in development). The book is based on lectures at the Karlsruhe University of Applied Sciences. Extensive prior knowledge is not expected; however, experience with a higher programming language is very helpful when reading. Fundamentals of Perl are briefly summarized. Based on this, selected Perl concepts are explained and shown what can be done with them. As a result, a collection of solutions to typical problem statements is created, which the reader can easily generalize for their own applications. Summaries of the individual chapters. Many examples and exercises. Interesting alternative to J. Schröter (BA 9/07). (2)

Praxis Wärmepumpe : Technology, Planning, Installation ¤ Due to rising energy prices and CO-2 reduction measures, the use of environmental heat is gaining more importance. For the author (energy advisor/renewable energies) heat pumps, together with thermal solar systems, wood heating systems, and ventilation systems, offer the optimal combination for using domestic energy sources. If the heat pump is operated with "eco-power", the CO-2 emission is reduced to a minimum. Starting from energy policy considerations, this book clearly and comprehensibly conveys the technology of heat pumps, the planning of a heat pump system, as well as the installation and commissioning with practical examples. With numerous, illustrative colored images, photos, and graphics, economic considerations, cost comparisons of heating systems according to VDI, standards, and regulations, glossary, manufacturer directory, and examples of applications, offers. The target group are skilled craftsmen, energy advisors, architects. High price of a professional book. After Michael Baumann (BA 8/07), alongside K. Ochsner (BA 9/07), before I. Tiator (ID 4/08) and W. Waldschmidt (ID 14/08). (2)

Digital German Lessons: Using New Media Productively ¤ The book presents methods and projects that allow new media to be used didactically reflected and productively in German lessons. The pedagogical discussion of digital media is still characterized by the fact that German lessons see their goal in preserving the

The Book of Proofs ¤ Verlagstext: In this excellent book, translated into German for mathematically interested readers, two top mathematicians have selected a series of mathematical problems that can be solved with elegant, aesthetically pleasing proofs. The result is a book that every mathematically interested person will have a lot of fun with!

Englisch für Architekten und Bauingenieure : ein kompletter Projektablauf auf Englisch mit Vokablen, Redewendungen, Übungen und Praxistipps : all project phases in English with vocabulary, idiomatic expressions, exercises and practical advice ¤ The author is an English native speaker and works as an architect, translator, and lecturer, among other things, for English for architects. The textbook, intended for self-study or also course-related, builds on existing school English and prepares through technical texts, typical dialogues, and business letters for work as a planner in and with the English-speaking abroad. In this way, the 12 chapters are practically oriented to the individual planning and implementation phases of a construction project. Each chapter also includes grammar and vocabulary parts and exercises, and special skills, such as letters, emails, phone calls, applications, etc. are treated. The solutions and 2 separate dictionaries end the book. The target group of this textbook are architects, civil engineers, students of both fields, translators, interpreters, and building owners. Can be offered as a good supplement to the pure technical dictionaries, e.g. "Langenscheidt-Routledge-Fachwörterbuch Kompakt Bauwesen Englisch" (ID 41/05) or "Langenscheidt-Routledge-Fachwörterbuch Architektur und Bauwesen" (ID 9/03). (3)

Learning from failure : a history-based, lightweight test prioritization technique connecting software changes to test failures ¤ Regression testing is a widespread practice in today's software industry to ensure software product quality. Developers derive a set of test cases, and execute them frequently to ensure that their change did not adversely affect existing functionality. As the software product and its test suite grow, the time to feedback during regression test sessions increases, and impedes programmer productivity: developers wait longer for tests to complete, and delays in fault detection render fault removal increasingly difficult. Test case prioritization addresses the problem of long feedback loops by reordering test cases, such that test cases of high failure probability run first, and test case failures become actionable early in the testing process. We ask, given test execution schedules reconstructed from publicly available data, to which extent can their fault detection efficiency improved, and which technique yields the most efficient test schedules with respect to APFD? To this end, we recover regression 6200 test sessions from the build log files of Travis CI, a popular continuous integration service, and gather 62000 accompanying changelists. We evaluate the efficiency of current test schedules, and examine the prioritization results of state-of-the-art lightweight, history-based heuristics. We propose and evaluate a novel set of prioritization algorithms, which connect software changes and test failures in a matrix-like data structure. Our studies indicate that the optimization potential is substantial, because the existing test plans score only 30% APFD. The predictive power of past test failures proves to be outstanding: simple heuristics, such as repeating tests with failures in recent sessions, result in efficiency scores of 95% APFD. The best-performing matrix-based heuristic achieves a similar score of 92.5% APFD. In contrast to prior approaches, we argue that matrix-based techniques are useful beyond the scope of effective prioritization, and enable a number of use cases involving software maintenance. We validate our findings from continuous integration processes by extending a continuous testing tool within development environments with means of test prioritization, and pose further research questions. We think that our findings are suited to propel adoption of (continuous) testing practices, and that programmers' toolboxes should contain test prioritization as an existential productivity tool.

Southeast Asia: Societies, Spaces, and Development in the 20th Century ¤ This collection of essays originated from a lecture series at the University of Vienna. In 14 challenging articles, renowned experts present the politically, ethnically, and culturally very heterogeneous region of Southeast Asia. The large area is distinguished by an insular-Malaysian part from a continental part and from the mountain regions in the northern border areas. The focus of the representation is on historical developments up to independence as well as physical and anthropogeographic aspects. Several authors deal with contemporary problems, i.e., deforestation of the rainforest, the development of megacities like Manila and Bangkok, the politicization of Islam, and the precarious position of ethnic minorities, especially the Chinese. The enormous dynamics of economic and political transformation since the beginning of the 20th century are clearly visible, making Southeast Asia one of the most interesting regions in the world. Supplementing, for example, J. Rüland (BA 8/98) and the East Asia volume from the same series (see BA 6/99). Also suitable for smaller libraries. (2) (Andreas Ufen)

Sustainable Logistics : Answers to a Global Challenge ¤ Logistics and Supply Chain Management will have to adapt to completely new boundary conditions and requirements in the foreseeable future. Starting from very ambitious target specifications for reducing pollutant emissions, policy will contribute to a significant increase in transport costs through various instruments such as tolls, consumption taxes, and a trade in tightly held emission certificates. In the same direction, rising oil prices and increasing productivity losses in freight traffic, which will have to cope with an increasingly overburdened traffic infrastructure, will also work. Against this background, logistics will make a strong contribution to the preservation of mobility and the environment and will have to reinvent itself in part. Starting from a description of the future boundary conditions, adaptation strategies are developed in this book that enable a less pollutant-intensive exchange of goods and can contribute to preserving mobility as a prerequisite for any division of labor economy. In this process, not only logistical process and network architectures are put to the test, but also the overarching marketing strategies and business models, from which modern logistics has emerged.

Stochastics : Theory and Applications ¤ Stochastic methods have high relevance in many parts of technology and computer science. For example, most modern procedures for digital data transmission, circuit simulation, but also process engineering and financial engineering are based on stochastic principles. The book offers a comprehensive and application-oriented introduction to probability theory and statistics. At the center are stochastic processes, especially Poisson processes, martingales, and Brownian motion, after a basic treatment of measure and integration theory and the foundations of probability theory. All results are thoroughly motivated and exactly proven. This makes the book an excellent choice for self-study and as accompanying literature for lectures. TOC: Measure Theory.- Probability Theory.- Stochastic Processes.- Mathematical Statistics and Statistical Data Analysis.- Appendix

Parasite Biology ¤ This volume, not yet displayed, is a biology of parasites for biologists and medical doctors (also veterinarians), now available in an expanded and above all adapted to the current state of science second edition (first edition 1997). General questions on definition, characteristics, co-evolution of parasite and host, etc. are treated in the first part. In the following three parts, single-celled parasites, worms, ticks and mites, crustaceans and insects are described. The book appears at Springer as study literature. Understanding questions follow each chapter, which are answered at the end of the book. The book is primarily aimed at students or practitioners of the above-mentioned disciplines. In addition to P. Wenk's "Parasitology" (ID 28/04), it can be used. It can replace D. Matthes: "Animal Parasites" (ID 41/88). Although frequent pests of humans (worms, lice, ticks) are also treated, looking up without certain familiarity with the terminology is little rewarding. Widely usable on the subject, lastly Marlene Zuk: "What would life be like without parasites?" (BA 8/08). (3) (Olaf Kaptein)

Digital Technology - a Practical Introduction ¤ Digital technology is omnipresent today. It combines many disciplines: physics, mathematics, electrical engineering, computer science, etc. This book brings both the necessary theory and a consistent reference to practice. Each chapter contains numerous tasks (unfortunately without solutions) and detailed literature references. On the internet, you can find additional exercises, examples, animations, and slides for lecturers. Worth mentioning is also an important aspect that is not often treated, namely verification. The lecture material serves mainly bachelor students as an introduction, especially beginners due to its applications tailored to them. Now it's not the 1st textbook; here only the newer ones: H.G. Fehn (ID 34/07), K. Beuth (BA 3/07), H.M. Lipp (ID 51/06), K. Fricke ID 32/00; Reprint: 2005), K. Urbanski (ID 3/04). Recommended, if there is too little of these in stock. (3)

Simplified Flow Zone Theory : on the basis of the Zarka Method ¤ For a life prediction of variable loaded structures, such as plant and machine construction as well as civil engineering, the cyclically accumulated distortions and possibly also the elastic-plastic extension wave widths are required. The Simplified Flow Zone Theory (VFZT) is a direct method that provides estimates of these and all other mechanical quantities in the elastic and plastic operating state. The present book presents the VFZT in detail and attaches importance to the fact that not only scientists, but also practicing engineers and students of higher semesters can form an image of the possibilities and limitations.

Cooperations between Science and Economy: Mechanisms and Barriers in Knowledge and Technology Transfer ¤ The knowledge and technology transfer from science (universities and research institutions) to the economy is one of the central sources for innovations. Its importance has increased again in view of the great proximity to science of the new high-tech fields such as artificial intelligence or biotechnology. Against this background, the state of the literature on knowledge and technology transfer in the context of cooperations between science and economy is critically examined in the framework of the study. For this purpose, an investigation grid was developed to examine the state of the literature. Central topics are the theoretical foundation of the research field, forms of cooperations, expectations of the participating actors, transfer barriers, political measures to promote knowledge and technology transfer and their effectiveness, the transfer of experiences from abroad and existing research gaps. The results show that the research field is very diverse. In the past decades, a wide range of results have been achieved, but there is still a wealth of open research questions, for example, with regard to the long-term effects of funding measures.

Significant? : Introduction to Statistical Methods for Teachers ¤ Publisher's text: The present volume of the series Lehren lernen supports you by clarifying fundamental concepts of quantitative scientific methods in connection with school and education. For this purpose, the authors convey the basics of statistics in a very understandable form in the form of a textbook and relate them to the practice of the teaching profession. Here you will learn the concept of statistical significance and understand

Mass Media in Germany ¤ The established standard work on the structure and system of media in Germany has been consistently revised and updated. A new chapter on global communication has been added. The crisis of the media industry since the beginning of the century, the rapid structural change of classical media press, radio, and television through the digitalization of communication are further important topics. The basic overview of the media landscape in Germany should be available in many libraries in the latest edition. (I. Müller-Boysen) General understandable, basic introduction to the political, legal, and technical development of mass media in Germany. (I. Müller-Boysen) The consistently updated new edition of the established standard work on "functions, structures, and developments" of mass media in Germany is characterized by the perception of a media landscape that is in the deepest crisis of the post-war period. Declining sales figures and dramatic declines in advertising revenue lead to bankruptcies, mergers, and mass layoffs. Many hopes that the industry, for example, in pay-TV and online offers, have proven to be an illusion. Hermann Meyn, who was chairman of the German Journalists' Association for over a decade and has been teaching as an honorary professor at the University of Hamburg since 2001, also addresses these current developments, which have left no media area untouched. (1 S)

Management of Virtual Enterprises : Software Support and Innovative Technologies ; [this publication arose in the framework of the project supported by the BMBF "Tool-Assisted Management of Knowledge-Intensive Services in Virtual Enterprises"] ¤ The present volume shows the professional requirements for software to support the management of service-oriented virtual enterprises. It describes with VICOPLAN a prototype developed within a BMBF-funded project with the title αTool-Assisted Management of Knowledge-Intensive Services in Virtual Enterprises± at the universities of Göttingen (Business Informatics II) and Munich (Business Informatics and New Media). Furthermore, it was analyzed whether virtual enterprises can be meaningfully supported by using innovative technologies such as XML, Web Services, and OLAP systems.

Textbook of Physical Chemistry ¤ The classic, all-encompassing textbook of Physical Chemistry now in its 5th edition! In this new edition, the proven concept of the previous edition has been retained and expanded with innovations in the field of Physical Chemistry. The "Wedler" is the textbook for all those who want to or even have to deal with Physical Chemistry and whose study will be associated with a significant gain in understanding of this subject

Industriespionage : the great attack on the middle class ¤ Impressively, this guide for medium-sized enterprises shows the daily threat of know-how leakage. The author not only highlights the dangers of economic espionage by foreign intelligence services, but also the risk of information loss through their own employees. The diverse threat spectrum from product piracy to organized crime to risks of new markets is presented to the reader. The guide provides detailed protection measures. The daily pitfalls in IT, TK data storage and protocols, in WLAN as well as the manipulations of TK devices are described in a tangible way. Based on numerous examples, the author illustrates that information protection requires the interconnection of all areas: IT/TK, personnel, processes, object security and security coordination, practical tips and definitions as well as checklists for successful security and crisis management complete the work. (Source: Text book cover / Publisher)

Future Energy Grid : Information and Communication Technologies for a Sustainable and Economical Energy System ¤ Germany's energy transition can only succeed with Smart Grids. By 2022, Germany wants to exit nuclear energy and switch to an energy supply based on renewable energies. These can only be integrated into the power grid to a large extent with the help of information and communication technologies (ICT). In a so-called Smart Grid, ICT and energy technology merge and provide sustainable, reliable, and affordable electricity – to the benefit of electricity customers, energy producers, and the German economy. But with the rebuilding of the electricity infrastructure, immense challenges also come to politics, economy, science, and the population. With eight theses, acatech sketches the future of energy supply in Germany and provides concrete action recommendations for the construction of the Future Energy Grids.

Responsive Webdesign : Concepts, Techniques, Practical Examples ¤ Internet users expect websites to look good and be easily usable on any device today. In the new, now 3rd edition of their very successful handbook on the topic of responsive web design, the two authors again show in a clear and practice-oriented way how web developers can implement these requirements in practice. In comparison to the first edition, the content has been strongly expanded and brought up to date. The layout and the successful color concept have been retained, a new chapter on performance optimization has been added. Conclusion: A comprehensive and up-to-date representation of creating adaptable websites, which shows the use of the necessary tools such as HTML5, CSS3, Media Queries, and JavaScript in many practical examples. Solid basic knowledge is assumed. An important title on the topic that covers all important aspects. In compact form also H. Hahn: "Webdesign"

Handbook for Corporate Environmental Management ¤ In compact form, this handbook provides the necessary knowledge for corporate, sustainable environmental management. It is designed as a reference work for the introduction and updating of an environmental management system. In addition, it can be used as a textbook regarding the basic aspects of corporate environmental management

Mozilla Firefox 3 : [Surfing for beginners with the Firefox browser into the Internet ; ad-free Zone- use of the Pop-up-Blocker ; my Firefox- customize and extend the browser] ¤ The popular Internet browser Firefox has been available since June in a new version. A first successful introduction to the use of the browser is provided by Prinz and Fickler (in this issue). This, also designed for beginners, introduction, a revision of the output to the previous version (BA 8/05; not available for comparison), deals with the most important functions. In the 11 chapters, the topics are: Description of the surface including adjustment options, possibilities for comfortable surfing, working with bookmarks, security considerations and search systems. Numerous extensions are also presented. The two final sections present the non-browser-related email program Thunderbird. The sparse innovations of the current version are not specifically highlighted, which is no drawback, as they are rather hidden and the book is primarily aimed at the Internet newcomer. The understandable information offered is accompanied by useful tips and black-and-white illustrations. The presented software is located on the CD-ROM. (1)

The Twitter Factor: Communication to the Point ¤ Verl.Beschr.: Twitter - Communication in Real-Time! Hardly any other medium in Web 2.0 provides current, accurate information as quickly as Twitter and connects people. Whether you want to track trends, find interesting business partners and experts or use Twitter for self-marketing (IBM) as a two-way communication tool, many additional applications offer unprecedented possibilities. German Twitter coaches Stefan Berns and Dirk Henningsen illustrate in this book how trainers, consultants, individual fighters and even companies can use this powerful communication tool. From generating new followers to the efficient use of various Twitter tools, the authors show what new possibilities Twitter offers for online PR, online marketing and customer binding. A fascinating book that shows how Twitter changes communication and what opportunities and possibilities the Twitter factor will offer in the future

Das Online-Handbuch : reveals: provider choice, email, eBay, Google, Skype, chatting, instant messaging and much more ; [virtual Linux PC in the security workshop ; on the CD: Firefox 1.5, Thunderbird 1.5, OpenOffice 2.01, Oleco NetLCR, Netstumbler, VMWare Player, WINRar and much more] ¤ Comprehensive volume that not only deals with all relevant topics of online communication, but also makes it in great detail. Joos, experienced IT expert and co-author of Stefan Blumhagel's book

The Kitchen: Living World, Use, Perspectives ¤ The new "Edition Wohnen" is published by art historians and scientists of the ETH Zurich's Wohnforum. The present collection deals with the kitchen as a central living space of domestic life, in which cultural and social changes are reflected: from the housewife in the 8-m² kitchen to the luxurious high-tech kitchen for trend-conscious hobby cooks. Topics include, among others, the historical development of the kitchen from the Gründerzeit to the present day (Frankfurter kitchen, living kitchen, norm kitchen), kitchen concepts and lifestyles, the development of the Swiss kitchen standard and European alternatives, modern kitchen planning today for patchwork families or single households. Visually appealing designed with many historical and current images, advertising materials, floor plans. Clearly written and scientifically founded with numerous literature references, addressed to interior architects and kitchen planners, but above all to the general public interested in culture. Worth reading alongside practical planning guides by V. Lee (BA 4/00) or G. Schönfeldinger (BA 2/00). (2) (Elke Nibbrig)

Information and Communication : Fundamentals and Procedures of Information Transmission ; with 24 Tables ¤ Modulation methods, coding techniques, and cryptography are closely related fields. The present textbook presents them comprehensively, methodically accurately, and mathematically understandable, with their interconnections. Starting from an introduction to information theory, topics are treated whose knowledge is necessary for the systematic analysis of systems for information transmission. These include source and channel coding, analog and digital modulation methods, as well as the description of stochastic processes. The book is rounded off by an extensive introduction to cryptography, in which, in addition to the most commonly used algorithms, the most important protocols are presented and analyzed. Special emphasis was placed on including modern methods such as, for example, Turbo Codes, OFDM, Elliptical Curves, or even quantum cryptography.

Adobe Illustrator CC : the practical introduction ¤ Latest version of the vector-oriented graphics and drawing program Adobe Illustrator CC 2019 is currently the one from February 2019 (23.0.2). The 2nd edition (2016) with 226 pages was last discussed, compared to the 3rd edition with 455 pages, the current edition was only slightly expanded. No indication of the underlying program version. Unchanged, you can still find almost as in the 1st edition (2013, text and image identical in some cases), innovations such as freehand path, adjustable toolbars, scalable workspace, start screen have been incorporated, but are not listed separately. Many program-related problems have been resolved. Like the previous editions, Flemming offers a solid, practice-oriented introduction. Previous versions do not necessarily have to be deleted. Example and exercise files can be found on the book's website

The Discovery of the Indivisible: Quarks, Quantum, and the Discovery of the Higgs Particle ¤ When the first edition of the book appeared (BA 12/10), the Large Hadron Collider had just been brought into operation. Shortly thereafter, in July 2012, the discovery of the long-sought Higgs particle was reported, which finally completed the Standard Model of particle physics. Reason enough to revise and expand the text for a second edition, particularly in this section, as well as to make further minor updates and corrections. In the meantime, however, a whole series of books on the discovery of the Higgs particle and the way there have appeared (e.g. R. Vaas: "From God Particle to World Formula", ID-A 6/14, "The Discovery of the Higgs Particle", ID-A 50/13, B. Lemmer: "Into the Proton's Interior"), so that the offer of comparable titles is larger. The topics here are the development of atomic physics from antiquity to the 20th century, the theory of relativity and quantum mechanics, the Standard Model of particle physics, the theory of gravity, and string theory. Thanks to the latest findings, it is almost unavoidable to replace the first edition. (2) (Michael Mücke) The author deals with the topics of ancient atomism, atomic physics, the theory of relativity and quantum mechanics, and the discovery of the Higgs particle. (Michael Mücke)

Planning of Public Passenger Transport ¤ Millions of people are transported daily in Germany alone by buses, trains, and airplanes. Public passenger transport (ÖV) is of great importance for the quality of life of individuals but also for the performance of entire regions. The quality and efficiency of ÖV systems depend on political framework conditions (state-planned, competitively organized) and the suitability of the infrastructure (railway systems, airport locations), the available traffic offer (schedules and flight plans), the use of suitable technologies (information, control, and booking systems) and the optimal use of operational resources (energy, vehicles, and personnel). The decision-making, planning, and optimization problems that arise in this context are sometimes gigantic and scream for support from mathematics due to their high complexity. This article outlines the current state and importance of the use of mathematics in planning and implementing public passenger transport, describes existing challenges, and suggests forward-looking measures.

Future Market Technologies for Material Recognition and Separation : Case Study Commissioned by the Federal Environment Agency within the Framework of the Research Project Innovative Environmental Policy in Key Areas of Action (Project Number 206 14 132/05) ¤ This case study on the field of action

Dairy Science and Milk Hygiene ¤ The following topics are treated, among others: History and economic importance of milk, Composition of milk, Udder health, Milk production, Quality control of delivered milk, Consumable milk, Dairy products (butter, cheese, raw milk), Microbiology (pathogenic microorganisms and toxins), Inhibitors - residues of antimicrobial active substances

Islam in the Media: Journalistic Quality in the Struggle over the Mohammed Cartoons ¤ Islam has become a top theme in the media in Germany. Almost daily, the German press reports on the integration of Muslims or developments in Muslim-dominated countries. The reporting thus determines the social discourse and decisively influences political debates. Reports without tendentious representations and evaluations are therefore urgently needed. Is there a need for action here? Based on journalistic quality criteria, Fabian Wahl examines the reporting in three German daily newspapers using the example of the dispute over the Mohammed cartoons. With the Süddeutsche Zeitung, the BILD-Zeitung, and the Bonner General-Anzeiger, he covers the entire spectrum from the nationwide quality newspaper to the opinion-forming tabloid to the independent regional newspaper. Empirically, the author checks the aspects of diversity, impartiality, accuracy, transparency, and understandability.

Mac OS X Snow Leopard : the comprehensive training ; over 14 hours of practical knowledge for version 10.6 - explained in a clear manner by Mac experts ; 120 lessons, 14 hours of playtime ¤ Comprehensive overview for beginners and switchers to the Mac under the new Snow Leopard operating system. Also considered are the programs iLife '09 and iWork '09 as well as the topic iPhone. (Klaus Barckow) Many books have already been discussed for the new Snow Leopard operating system, including Th. Armbruster (BA 2/10), Sc. Kelby (BA 2/10) and A. Cherif (BA 12/09). The authors are mostly known through books for previous operating system versions. The present video training is an interesting alternative in non-print form. It offers a practice-oriented introduction that familiarizes the reader with all important work processes on the Mac under Snow Leopard. Emphasis is placed on installation and system configuration, file management, and work simplification through Dock, the digital desk. But also the work with the Mac in networks and on the internet is well considered. Error detection and error correction are not forgotten either. The explanations on the programs iLife '09 and iWork '09 offer a look beyond the horizon. Important for iPhone owners is the demonstration of control functions for this special Apple smartphone. - Easy retracing of the material using the live mode on one's own computer. (2) (Klaus Barckow)

The Network Master : a collection of tasks for examination and practice of electrical power supply ¤ The book includes construction, operation, monitoring, protective measures and disturbances of and in supply networks, topics that a network master, who takes care of these networks, should be familiar with. The entire material is implemented here in questions with sometimes very detailed answers at the end of the chapter and serves mainly for examination preparation but also as a reference work (in addition to introductions, textbooks, etc.). The 1st edition (ID 48/96) was already expanded in the 2nd edition of 2004, mainly but in the course of advancing technology and changing standards, which require continuous further education, adapted to the latest state; the bibliography was also updated. In well-stocked holdings, the title should be available and here at least the 1st edition should be replaced. (3)

Scientific Investigation and Evaluation of the Indicator "Ecological Footprint" : Research Report 363 01 135 ¤ The Ecological Footprint indicator is one of the most successful indicators worldwide for conveying the concept of ecological sustainability and the physical limitations of the planet Earth. The footprint has established itself over the past 10 years as one of the most important measures for resource consumption of production and consumption activities on an international level and is applied by a variety of institutions for the evaluation of environmental impacts of human activities. Examples of application as an indicator on a national level are currently only sporadic.[...] (Source: Publisher)

The Mini-Block Heat Power Plant : a heating system that also generates electricity ; with new laws and incentives from 1.1.2009 ¤ Compact and concise representation of small block heat power plants based on the combined heat and power principle using waste heat for heating purposes. Provides information on economic efficiency and examples from practice; the topic has gained importance as an example of environmentally friendly energy supply. Compared to the 3rd edition (ID 5/07), it has been expanded by about 20 pages and supplemented with new developments and guidelines (including incentives from 2009). The layout and equipment (more illustrations) have also been improved. The old edition can be discarded, but it is recommended to supplement it with this edition. Not cheap. (3)

Foundations of Construction Theory : Methods and Examples for Mechanical Engineering ; with 103 Tables, numerous Knowledge Questions and Problem Statements with Solutions ¤ Practice-oriented textbook on the construction process, on design and planning criteria, cost factors, quality characteristics. Brings concise definitions and understandable explanations with simple examples and numerous exercise tasks (with solutions). Was expanded by about 180 pages compared to the 1st edition 1998 (BA 2/99) (numerous new methods and examples) and more strongly oriented towards application in mechanical engineering. Still a widely usable textbook for students at universities and universities of applied sciences. The old edition should be replaced. (2)

Guide to Energy-Efficient Building and Renovation: Neutral Expert Information for Increased Energy Efficiency ¤ Competent, product-neutral guide for homeowners and potential builders on the topic of energy-efficient, healthy building and modernization. The new edition appears at the same price as an identical community edition of the publishers Blottner and Fraunhofer IRB (ISBN 978-3-8167-9182-9). In comparison to the 4th edition of 2009 (BA 9/09) more readable due to a 2-column layout, consistently updated, expanded and brought up to date with the current regulations and building insulation standards (EnEV 2014). Previous editions must be replaced. Further recommended as a basic title. Before G. Hopfensperger: "Renovate and Modernize" (ID-B 34/14), "From Old Building to Efficiency House" (ID-A 21/14), K. Micksch: "Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energies ... " (in this issue) and U. Stempel: "Insulate and Renovate in Old and New Buildings" (ID-B 43/11) with each a differently focused emphasis. (1) (LK/KA: Nibbrig) Product-neutral guide for homeowners and potential builders on the topics of energy-efficient and healthy building as well as modernization. (LK/KA: Nibbrig)

The Heidelberg Karl-Theodor Globe from 1751 to 2000: Preserving the Past with Present Methods for the Future ¤ A successful example of a lively collaboration with different disciplines is illustrated by the restoration of this important cultural asset: The Heidelberg example of a Vaugondy globe from 1751 has a varied history and was recently restored with modern methods. Historical sources on the production of globes were consulted just as much as modern mathematical procedures from image processing, with which the digitized world map was filtered. In addition, an insight into the importance of globes and the emergence of a new world view in the 18th century, which was accompanied by the scientific academies, was gained in the confrontation with historical aspects. TOC:Introduction:Interdisciplinarity - and an 18th-century terrestrial globe.- Paris, Mannheim, Heidelberg: The path of two globe pairs through the Palatinate.- On the art-historical significance of the stand.- The restoration of the globe.- Map projection versus image processing - the role of mathematics in the restoration process.- Historical significance.- Facsimiles.- Index.- Illustration index

Cyber-Physical Systems : Innovation Driver for Mobility, Health, Energy, and Production ¤ Already today, about 98 percent of microprocessors embedded in everyday objects and devices are connected to the outside world through sensors and actuators. Increasingly, they are interconnected with each other and the Internet. The physical world is merging with the virtual world, the Cyberspace. Cyber-Physical Systems are emerging. Future Cyber-Physical Systems will make significant contributions to security, efficiency, comfort, and human health in ways hardly imaginable today and will help solve central challenges of our society, such as an aging population, resource scarcity, mobility, or the energy transition. Germany has the chance to secure a leading position in international competition with innovative Cyber-Physical Systems. The conditions that need to be created for this and how Germany can overcome the technical, political, and social hurdles on the way there are named by acatech in this position paper.

Final Report for Investigation and Development of a Procedure for Biological Methane Enrichment of Biogas using an Innovative Trickling Filter Process (Internal and External Biological Methane Enrichment in the Trickling Filter Process – An Upgrade for Classical Biogas Plants) ¤ A possibility for improving the utilization rate of seasonally and weather-dependent fluctuating power generation from renewable energy sources is the Power-to-Gas strategy. In this process, electrical energy, preferably

Richard Neutra in Berlin : the History of the Zehlendorf Houses ¤ As soon as his name is mentioned, they come to mind: generously composed into nature, light-filled bungalows that shape the architectural style of the American West Coast around Los Angeles. That Richard Neutra's (1892?1970) career began in Berlin-Zehlendorf is sometimes overlooked. However, it is precisely the Zehlendorf houses that represent an extremely fascinating chapter in Neutra's work. They reveal not only the experimental and radically innovative design with their complex color concept and extravagant interior design. Rather, one can already see hints in this little-known aspect of his building that can be found in subsequent projects. The present publication honors the early work of one of the main representatives of classical modernism and presents, in addition to historical sources, new, previously unpublished documentation of the houses and their first inhabitants

SchreibKunstRäume : Calligraphy in Space ¤ The traditional art form of calligraphy is also a means of wall and space design. Beautifully used, it can enhance and deepen the effect of the space as well as the text. This book brings together 26 projects by the letter artist Propfe from completely different rooms (private, public, commercial). In addition to the presentation of the completed project in its entirety and in detail, sketches and wall patterns show the design and working process. An inspiring book and gift for painters and space designers, interior architects as well as private and commercial builders.

Learning Tourism Regions : Networking as a Strategic Success Factor for Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises ¤ By introducing resources of small and medium-sized tourist enterprises (SMEs) into a field of action through cooperation or networking and mutual knowledge exchange, a learning region is created: It provides pooled and accessible resources for SMEs and thus strengthens their competitiveness and market ability. These connections have been uncovered in an analysis of two tourism regions. At the same time, obstacles to establishing a learning tourism region have also been brought to light. A prototype of a learning region shows how these obstacles can be overcome with what instruments.

Long-term Environmental Balance and Future Potential of Alternative Drive Technologies ¤ The aim of the present study is to perform an economic and ecological evaluation for alternative fuels and drives for passenger cars in the compact class in Germany for 2020 and 2030. The economic evaluation is carried out according to a Total-Cost-of-Ownership approach, without taxes, levies and subsidies being taken into account. The ecological evaluation is carried out according to the Life-Cycle-Assessment approach. In the context of drive change in passenger cars, battery-electric mobility will probably play the most important role by 2030 and beyond. It is already available on a larger scale commercially today. It is the most economical and energy-efficient of the available reduction options with high potential. The challenge lies in the fact that certain limits are set by the speed of market penetration. Plug-in hybrids can take on a bridging function. Other options, in particular biogas and also synthetic fuels, can contribute to a reduction in THG emissions in passenger car traffic by 2030 at highest in a small extent due to potential limitations and high costs. In the long term, fuel cell passenger cars could still represent an addition.

Cruise and Data Report of the Research Cruise KERNE 2000 with WFS Planet from 25.4. - 28.4.2000 ¤ From 25 to 28 April 2000, a research cruise with WFS Planet took place in the central Baltic Sea. The aim of the cruise was to identify suitable deployment positions for the FWG research projects RADIS (Reverberation, Attenuation and Detection in the Sediment) and EXSESO (Experimental Sediment Sonar), as well as to conduct bottom investigations for mine hunting in the Baltic Sea. Investigations with side-looking sonar, video recordings, and core sampling were carried out in possible deployment areas west of Warnemünde and northeast of Darßer Ort. Within the framework of the bottom investigations, several core positions between Kiel and Darßer Ort were sampled. In total, 14 vibrocores with core lengths between 5 cm and 180 cm were retrieved, 3 box corer samples and 1 gravity corer (gain 290 cm) were taken. The report is a compilation of all measurement data from the research cruise.(AUT)

Sound Technology for Media Designers: Hearing Sounds - Understanding Technology - Designing Media ¤ Fundamental yet practice-oriented textbook on all areas of sound technology for individuals from related professions. (Ulrich Wesser) The author deals with all areas of sound technology in this book conceived as a textbook and prepares them for media designers and individuals from other related professions: sound in physics, electrical engineering, human biology, technical tools for transmission, manipulation, recording, and playback, specific requirements for modern sound technology. In addition, adjacent areas are also illuminated, such as production organization. The structure is strongly differentiated but quickly graspable, the descriptions are very precise, sufficiently detailed, and understandable, the explanations are sparingly illustrated with illustrative graphics. Despite the claim to be able to do without mathematical or physical knowledge, knowledge of, for example, specialized terminology facilitates understanding. Conclusion: Fundamental yet practice-oriented textbook for newcomers and professionals working in a field adjacent to sound technology. (3) (Ulrich Wesser)

AutoCAD 2011 Beginner Seminar ¤ Introduction course to the current version of the well-known CAD program. Contains, as before, a learning part with theoretical basics, a practice part with tasks and solutions, as well as an application part with practical examples and explanations. It is aimed at beginners without special CAD knowledge and is still suitable for a broad user group. It has been updated compared to the 2010 release (BA 11/09) and expanded with new applications (modeling with surfaces). The old release can be consumed, but should be supplemented with this new release. (2)

Computeralgebra ¤ Computeralgebra refers to the boundary between algebra and computer science, which deals with the design, analysis, implementation, and application of algebraic algorithms. In line with this view, the author presents some computer algebra systems and demonstrates their capabilities through examples. Basic techniques, such as computing with large integers, are investigated. For complex questions like polynomial factorization, several algorithms are offered, as they have different strengths. Often, the apparent detour through other mathematical structures is the fastest way. In the first chapters, the necessary mathematical foundations are provided. The following chapters can then be read largely independently of each other. All presented algorithms are justified and partly presented in a pseudocode language. The book is equally aimed at students of mathematics and computer science. TOC:Introduction.- What is computer algebra? Literature. Computer algebra systems.- Foundations. Algorithms and their complexity. Canonical normal forms. Transformation systems. Ideal resultants. Partial fraction decompositions. Some limitations.- Computing with homomorphic images. Basic ideas. The Chinese remainder theorem. Hensel's lemma.- Basic algebraic structures. Integers. Rational numbers. Algebraic numbers and functions. Nested radicals. General algebraic expressions. Transcendental expressions. Finite fields. Polynomials.- Polynomial factorization. Motivation. Square-free factorization. The Berlekamp algorithm. Berlekamp-Hensel factorization.- A Appendix. CA systems.- B Appendix Example sessions. Maple. Mathematica. Gap

Raspberry Pi : the comprehensive handbook ¤ In addition to the numerous titles on the Raspberry Pi minicomputer (most recently Simon Monk), this book stands out from the three known authors in terms of scope and breadth of topics. It covers almost the entire range of topics and addresses both experienced RaspPi enthusiasts and beginners equally. In addition to special RaspPi knowledge, the book also conveys basics on the topics of electrical engineering, hardware, and programming. The now available 4th edition shows only minor differences from the predecessor. A comprehensive update led to adjustments in some subchapters and subheadings. Now the Raspberry Pi Zero W is taken into account (update of the stripped-down Raspberry Pi Zero), there are changes in SSH configuration, and new hardware components (fingerprint and fine-tipped sensors, Pimoroni Zero LiPo expansion board, etc.) have been added. Numerous circuit diagrams, graphics, and project descriptions. Well suited, but primarily for the first-time purchase and for stocking. (1)

Privacy in the Internet : Seizing Opportunities, Assessing Risks, Shaping Trust ¤ Basic Values -- Privacy in the Internet: a Challenge -- Theses on the Development of a Culture of Privacy in the Internet -- Recommendations for Action -- The Next Step. With its digital marketplaces, search engines, social networks, and many other services, the Internet can contribute to the realization of fundamental European values: free self-determination, political participation, and economic well-being of people. However, users often pay for Internet services with data rather than money, which puts their privacy at risk. In view of this tension, acatech shows how an Internet culture can be developed that allows the opportunities of the Internet to be seized while protecting the privacy of people. This acatech position contains concrete recommendations for action, how education, economy, law, and technology can contribute to such a culture.

Inside Airport : Technology, Flight Operations, Safety ¤ Reich bebilderte Darstellung der Abläufe in einem Flughafen - from baggage control over maintenance work up to takeoff and landing. The author is a pilot and provides information from 1st hand

Report of the Federal Ministry of Health and the Federal Environment Agency to consumers on the quality of water for human consumption (drinking water) in Germany (2014 - 2016) : Reporting period: 1 January 2014 to 31 December 2016 : in accordance with § 21 Drinking Water Ordinance based on the format for reporting by the competent highest state authorities (Bundesgesundheitsblatt 2013·56:1191-1215) ¤ The present report is based on the reports of the federal states to the Federal Ministry of Health (BMG) and the Federal Environment Agency (UBA) for the period from 2014 to 2016. The form of the report is based on the report format prescribed by the European Commission, which is binding for the annual reports of the state authorities. In 2016, 72.4 million people, approximately 88% of the population of Germany, were supplied with 4,350.8 million m³ of drinking water (from central facilities) in 2,490 water supply areas (distribution of more than 1,000 m³ of drinking water per day or supply of more than 5,000 people). The raw water for the treatment of the drinking water supplied in these areas came from 69.1% groundwater, 15.6% surface water, 8.2% bank filtration, 7.0% artificially enriched groundwater, and 0.1% from other resources. The drinking water in these water supply areas is of very good quality. More than 99.9% of the examined samples met the requirements of the Drinking Water Ordinance, i.e., the limit values were complied with.

Relief of the Environment and Traffic through Regional Economic Circuits : Research Report 29896151 ¤ The traffic performance has increased more strongly over the past few decades than the real gross domestic product. Compared to 1997, a further increase in road traffic performance of 50 and 79% is forecasted until 2015. Regional economic circuits are seen as a means to counteract the trend of disproportionately increasing traffic flows structurally and in the long term. In the study, the relationships between economic and traffic development on a regional level were explored. Furthermore, possibilities are discussed to promote regional economic circuits and thus reduce the volume of interregional transport. Traffic flows, environmental relief, regional economies, regional policies, structural policies, economic promotion, promotion programs

Small Sewage Treatment Plants Today ¤ Comprehensive overview for professionals and planners in water management, but also for homeowners on small sewage treatment plants, i.e. small plants with biological wastewater treatment. The number of building permits for small sewage treatment plants has doubled in the last 2 years and the German standard DIN 4261 has been replaced by the European standard DIN EN 12566. These reasons led to a rapid update to the latest state of the art and standardization, a stronger consideration of plant-based sewage treatment plants and almost a doubling of the scope compared to the 1st edition (ID 36/04 - must be replaced). In addition, chapters on biological processes of wastewater treatment, on the hygienization of wastewater, on alternative solutions for wastewater treatment, on tightness tests and wastewater disposal obligations have been newly taken up. Following the generally understandable guide by W. Lack: "Wastewater treatment with plants" (BA 1/07) and in addition to F. Wissing (ID 29/03) primarily recommended for libraries in East and North Germany, respectively libraries with corresponding specialist readership. (3) (Elke Nibbrig)

Graphics and GUIs with MATLAB ¤ Content: Full updates reflecting improvements in MATLAB 6.x. Expanded discussions on 2-D and 3-D graphics. New chapters on good GUI design and data visualization techniques. Output visualizations. Updated language commands. Deeper coverage of programming techniques, such as data structures and loop techniques.

Manned Spacecraft : Since 1960 ¤ The well-known author and long-time EADS employee (lastly "Rocket Types Book", BA 6/08) devotes himself to manned spaceflight since 1960 in the present book. The author limits himself to spacecraft and the corresponding programs, space stations are not treated. The small and compact booklet appears in the series "Type Compass" and offers series-typical short and concise information with many illustrations and data tables. Also presented are planned projects such as the Orion Program (which should replace the Space Shuttle from 2015) or the Altair Moon Ferry. Conclusion: a compact, informative, and affordable book, very well suited as a current supplement to more comprehensive, older spaceflight titles. (2) (LK/MZ: Steiner) Review: The well-known author and long-time EADS employee (lastly "Rocket Types Book", BA 6/08) devotes himself to manned spaceflight since 1960 in the present book. The author limits himself to spacecraft and the corresponding programs, space stations are not treated. The small and compact booklet appears in the series "Type Compass" and offers series-typical short and concise information with many illustrations and data tables. Also presented are planned projects such as the Orion Program (which should replace the Space Shuttle from 2015) or the Altair Moon Ferry. Conclusion: a compact, informative, and affordable book, very well suited as a current supplement to more comprehensive, older spaceflight titles. (2)

Eurotopians : Fragments of Another Future ¤ How do we want to live? How will we build? Where can we find ideas for the houses and cities of the future? Niklas Maak and Johanna Diehl dedicate themselves to these pressing questions in their joint project "Eurotopians". In times of upheaval, the book casts a look back at the work of European utopians to find visions for the present. - In the 1960s and 1970s, visionary architectures emerged in Europe, fundamentally questioning common notions of living. Many of these buildings have fallen into disrepair, their architects forgotten - although they still live there. Maak has visited them and created an "Archaeology of the Utopian", which shows that in the ruins, crucial ideas for the world of tomorrow can be found. Johanna Diehl has created impressive photographs of great intensity there. In the ruins of utopian modernity, she discovers images of revolutionary life concepts that seem surprisingly up-to-date. (Publisher's text)

F0rb1dd3n Network : Anatomy of a Hack ¤ This book on information technology security is primarily aimed at somewhat inattentive administrators. Their interest is to be sparked by a thriller story that occupies the first 40 percent of the book. Two young hackers get entangled with sinister other hackers, giving the authors the opportunity to describe a series of attacks on WLANs and PCs, which are then commented on in the second part of the book. These chapters contain a lot of information about common methods and tools used by hackers, but also about countermeasures that a prudent IT department can take. Many links and further literature references can be found, but almost only US sources. There are also descriptions of some programs used by hackers, but also by network administrators, e.g. to detect attacks from the outside for the first time. This is the translation of the 2nd edition with a completely new factual part (the 1st US edition contained many plagiarisms and was withdrawn). (2)

Logical Foundations of Mathematics ¤ The book conveys basic logical knowledge, fundamental proof principles, methods, and insights that every mathematician should possess. The following questions are addressed: What distinguishes finite from infinite sets? How can the whole, rational, and real numbers be constructed from natural numbers and the latter from pure sets? Which fundamental set-theoretic constructions are used for this and in mathematics in general? What are the basic topological properties of the set of real numbers? What is the continuum hypothesis? Why is the axiom of choice needed? Can the natural or real numbers be completely axiomatically described? With the help of the ultrapower method, non-standard numbers are constructed. Furthermore, a readily accessible proof of Gödel's First Incompleteness Theorem is provided. Written for: Students of mathematics. (3)

Is the State an Outdated Model? ¤ In his carefully argued and well-documented plea, Erhard Eppler clearly shows how important the state is and that we can by no means dispense with it. In doing so, it becomes apparent that the former Minister of Economic Development also has the South of the Earth in mind.

Introduction to Visual Basic 2017 ¤ Visual Basic is an object-oriented programming language from Microsoft. The author of the book is known for a variety of introductions to computer science topics under the title "Introduction to ...". His introduction to an earlier version ("... in Visual Basic 2013" has already been discussed. W. Doberenz also introduces the current version of the language, but assumes more prior knowledge from the reader. The present book relies on numerous tasks and exercises (with solutions in the appendix). The reader is thus introduced to programming with Visual Basic under the development environment Visual Studio 2017 in small steps. Emphasis is placed on basics (variables and data types, operators, controls, branching, loops, ...) and error handling. Database applications with ADO.NET and Internet applications with ASP.NET are also well considered, as well as creating drawings with the GDI+ library. At the end, there are 2 large example projects, the game Tetris and a vocabulary trainer. - Also suitable for self-study

IT Architectures : Planning, Integration, Maintenance ¤ In the present book, the authors show how IT systems can be structured and deal with the question of how different IT systems communicate with each other and how the complexity of IT environments can be mastered using suitable structuring. These questions gain greater importance in the age of increasing networking. The considerations made are independent of whether the considered elements are software or hardware components. It becomes clear that an IT architecture is always composed of various hierarchical levels (starting from individual components to systems and up to domains of interacting systems) and can only be understood in the interplay of the hierarchical levels.
